v2w4BNVQ8L6vCZ22CObVHA.text: There are many good Italian restaurants in Scottsdale. This is NOT one of them. I was very surprised to see any good reviews of this dive and surmise that the owner has family writing them. We went there and had shoddy service--the impression that the place was doing you a favor by letting you spend your money there--awful food (canned spaghetti would have been better), and a cramped filthy restroom. Go anywhere but here.

TnPPJnT7pYgjt1ixyX8xDQ.text: I love there food! Not once have I had a bad meal, service is slow, but I can get over that. As long as you keep my whiskey glass full, I'm a happy camper.

DVVt_2jd0V9X_87YVyXR9g.text: Seriously, where are all these positive reviews from??  I was in Scottsdale for business and loved the look of this restaurant, so I stopped on my own for dinner.  There were a few tables left at 7 on a Wednesday night.  I walked in and stood at the door for 5 mins with the door man standing in front of me and never making eye contact with me.  When I asked for a table, he saw I was alone and told me I could sit at the bar.  Being I'd been working all day, I had my computer bag with me and I wanted to sit down and enjoy a meal.  He reluctantly seated me.  I ordered the garlic bread appetizer and baked ziti.  He told me the meal comes with soup or salad, I ordered the salad with ceasar dressing on the side.  I was told ceasar dressing would cost the same as a ceasar salad, $8 more dollars.  Of course this is ridiculous, so I asked for the regular salad, NO dressing.  He repeated that, I said yes, and he said ok, that and your garlic bread will be out soon.  So, my salad comes and it's a really beautiful salad, large portion, fresh veggies, and drowning in dressing.  Two bites into it, I couldn't stand it and placed it on the other side of the table.  10 mins later my waiter noticed it, and I reminded him, no dressing.  I said don't worry about it.  He said he'd take care of it.  He came back with a ceasar salad with the dressing on the side.  Very nice, but the salad was lettuce, lettuce, lettuce, a peppercinni, and two rings of red onion.  What?  I thought this was an Italian place.   So, a basket of bread shows up and a few minutes later my entree arrives.  It was pretty good, but nothing special.  A different server came by and I stopped him to ask if the bread in the basket was my garlic bread (it was so dark there was no way to tell).  He said no, I asked to please have it sent out so I could enjoy it with the rest of my meal.  A couple minutes later I see him telling my server the problem and they were close enough that I spoke up to tell him, yes, the garlic bread never came.  The helping server looked at me and yelled, "They're making it!"  Excuse me??  Now I've got 3 bites left and my waiter stops by my table and says, "do you want us to make you some garlic bread on us?"  What?  By this time it should have already come out.  Why are you asking me now if I want it?  I ordered it didn't I?  And get this, he didn't even wait for me to answer.  I took another 15 minutes to get my check.  And yes, I still tipped %15 even though they should have been sending me out with a comp dessert.  Which is really a shame because I'm a very generous tipper.  Not that night!  One thing they do have going for them, the only thing they are on top of offering fresh pepper and parm cheese on appropriate items.  Needless to say, I will not be going back to Italian Grotto, AND I will make sure none of my many co-workers waster their or company money at this hole!!

Jk0LgBDWhi4Idp3K-IVVAQ.text: On a business trip I stopped here for lunch one day.  I had spaghetti and meatballs.  It was very average, I would say no better than the Olive Garden.  The service was decent and quick.  The atmosphere was pretty cool too.  There is better Italian food at a Deli / Italian grocery down the street, much better.

gA2L4MBzGUVeyELptH3_aA.text: While we went to Old Town Arizona and were a little bored. We stopped in the Italian Grotto and had so much fun we couldn't wait to get back. Besides the Owner being a character and charming the food  was outrageously good. It was like being in Ny . The Chicken piccata  was tender and full of flavor , and the drinks were REAL  drinks. Great bartenders as well . We stayed for over 3 hours and watched the sports with all the guys at the bar. Great place to come if your on business.. Well be back for sure

MvRb2tXYbcfwtXAxawtg3g.text: We ate here while on a weekend get away. When we first walked in I could not figure out if it were a bar or restaurant. We ordered calamari, mussels, and a caesar salad after waiting for what seemed like forever. The mussels were good but everything else including the drink was not good and the service was basically non existent.

fJvREHCkeRIy3wWnmNeteQ.text: My boyfriend and I were looking to celebrate because I got a new job and he made a big sale for work. Therefore, we began looking up good Italian food on Yelp and found the Italian Grotto, which happens to be right by where by boyfriend works.   We went to dinner pretty early so we were one of the very few people in there besides  some individuals whom were there for happy hour. We started with a nice bottle of chardonnay and calamari. We were big fans of the calamari, I tend to see quite a few reviews on Yelp that suggest some people think all calamari was created equal and I disagree. The breading was very light and crispy and had some spice to it, the squid itself was very tender and was what I consider the perfect consistency for fried calamari.   One of the only downfalls of the whole meal was the bread that was first brought out. We were pretty hungry when we got in and the bread didn't come until right before the calamari, a good 10 minutes after the drinks, and when it came it became clear that this bread had been sitting out for quite some time and was starting to harden up. Certainly not a deal breaker but something I tend to look forward to when heading out for Italian cuisine.   Next came the salads, I had the red wine vinaigrette and my boyfriend had the bleu cheese. Both of the dressings had great taste, my only criticism would be that the lettuce was not dried off very well after washing, once again not a huge issue, but something we remembered.   Finally, the entrees. I ordered the scallops in a white wine sauce over a bed of pasta, and my boyfriend got the Chilean sea bass over spinach ravioli. Not the absolute best scallops or piece of Chilean sea bass we had ever had but the sauces they came in were to die for. Then the waiter noticed how much we were digging the sauce and brought us out a basket of fresh bread still warm and soft. I don't think they had to put those plates in the dishwasher after we were through with them.   Our server did a great job, he was knowledgeable, friendly, and most importantly gave you space without being negligent. The atmosphere was precisely what I look for in an Italian restaurant. It's casual enough to be fun and relaxed, great music playing the whole time (Dean, Frank and company), very colorful obscure painting on the walls, but also had the ambiance to back up its pricing.   We wanted to get desert but we had a hard time standing up straight we were so full. So we didn't for a while, enjoyed our seat next to the window as the sun was setting on Old Town Scottsdale and watched the world go by as we finished up our bottle of chardonnay. All in all a tad on the expensive side but I certainly will be going back to try a few other things on the menu.

afEFd7A2ARcmwKK2Y2NUVw.text: Awesome food.  Recommended to go here by a local and glad we did. The chicken piccata was freaking amazing, some of the best I've had. They will also make it spicy to add a little kick. Additionally, the side of pasta was fabulous, also able to add spice. It was recommended that I don't go above 2 if I'd never been here before. I took a chance at 5, and it was perfect in every flaming way. But on the edge and don't let it go down wrong or risk death by coughing. My lips are still tingling. I wouldn't want to see what 10 is like!  Atmosphere sportsy, but really cool. Owner seems like a cranky Brooklyn gypsy/pirate (in the most respectful way.) I'd definitely come back.

Xx5YugK_4Kq9XggXguYuNw.text: I was recently in Old town Scottsdale and was looking for a restaurant that would allow me to bring my dog as the hotel I was staying in would not let me leave him in the room if I was not there. After walking around old town doing some shopping I was ready for a nice meal. It was a beautiful night and I came across this restaurant. I spotted a waiter and asked if I could sit outside with my dog. He said no problem, so we were seated and immediatly he brought over some dog cookies to win over my pup. I ordered the Chilian Bass which was awesome, then followed it with ricotto filled cannoli. My waiter Pedro was very attentive and seeing I was alone made sure to come over to check on me often even bought me a glass of wine. I will definetly visit again next time I'm in town.

eR8OLIIjwVX6sg4qD2hWoQ.text: SOOOO good. Don't be fooled by the exterior, this place was beautiful on the inside and the food, so delicious! My kids even loved it. They definitely are not set up to handle kids (one high chair and no kids menu), but our server was great with my 4 and 1 year old sons, as was ever other employee that brought anything over to our table at any point.   It was a bit pricey, so I probably wouldn't go back with my kids, but (if I was in the area again), I'd totally want to go back. Great for a date night!

VW8cs57UIRe0gaXJWClmfw.text: Went there with another couple.  Right off the bat, our waiter told us that the service is lousy but the food is good, which is why people keep coming back.  We appreciate honesty.  I had the veal carolina, which was among the best Italian I've ever had.  My wife had baked ravioli, which she thought was just alright.  The other couple we were with liked their food as well, one having a different veal dish and the other the sea bass.  The service really wasn't all that lousy but it definitely was sub par (we waited for the check for a while).  This is probably because our waiter was an ex-football player who we're sure was concussed one too many times.  Another waiter (we're assuming the owner) saw to our table as well and talked to us how the other waiter isn't going anywhere.  It's good to see people taking care of people.  Though the service wasn't the quickest, our drinks were always full and the waiters are happy to chit chat.  Very personable and quite the characters.  I'd be happy to go back and try some more of their food.  It's a bit pricier than places not in Scottsdale but I've had worse food that was more expensive (like Rustler's Roost).

ieVTl3RRaOy_VDdWlqyrgg.text: Despite the front door being open and the waiter at the door, they would not let us in until they were open.  It was 10:55 a.m. I wished later we hadn't returned. My salad had a piece of black and white plastic in it, like someone had torn open a bag and the corner had fallen into the salad. This salad was $19.00 for lettuce and four shimp.  On the other hand, the garlic toast was awesome.  With my husband's pasta, is was a $50 lunch!  First Yelp Review, Deb H

yKqVGrZpYvnE1kf8beyHvA.text: Will never be back. Look up the definition of rude and you will see a picture of the owner! I have never been so disrespected by someone...so much so that I heard what he said AFTER I left and I stopped my shopping trip and went back to confront him!!!

8iLcgXBwhCQWu6caymcY4Q.text: I wish I there were less than 1 star.  Every negative review is True plus more! I travel for my job, so I usually din alone.  The owner, or the homeless looking guy that runs the place, refused to serve me cause I was alone and could afford to have one person taking up a table.  When I questioned why, his attitude went from extremely rude to crazy!  The next day I went back to complain (not knowing the man I was going to complain about was the owner.  He yelled at me to get out of there or he would call the police.  Long story short, he called the cops on me, so I in turn filed a complaint.  So, if you feel like you have been physically mis treated, call the  cops and get this man out of there!

QMQxvLCL51gqVSqWUK8VSQ.text: Romantic cozy Italian restaurant in the heart of old town, a little on the dated side of things. This place reminds me of Bautistia's hole in the wall in Vegas. They  have cioppinio!!! I never have left here hungry or not thoroughly entertained.  Great food, great wine selection and the people watching is awesome on the patio.  I passed by this place so many times... this is a great place to eat, don't need to get all fancy for and has great servers.

ToJVUpwyV7XbhMTxHj9OZA.text: We come to Scottsdale seasonally each winter but this was the first time we tried the Italian Grotto. It is located on a prime corner in Old Town Scottsdale, so it is most definitely geared for tourists although I'm certain they have a local following as well. All of the people we dealt with were very friendly and service oriented. Each one seemed to be in character matching the theme of the restaurant. Sports memorabilia adorn the walls and other photos, etc. that fit the restaurant/ sports bar theme they have chosen. My wife had the eggplant parmesan ($21) which was good and I had the spaghetti and meatballs. ($14) which was just OK. Their sauce for the spaghetti is a bit too sweet and has too much basil in it for my taste. So, you can see the prices are really too high for typical Italian dinner menu items. We also ordered garlic bread ($6). It was over priced for what we expected. After drinks, our bill was about $67 before tip. That is just too much for what we got. So, you might want to think about that before you try it. I understand it has been there for some 42 years, so they are definitely a landmark place in Old Town. We might go back for a special dinner during a night out, but not for a regular meal.

ILfgWT8GT-0UXaf8nr670g.text: Very ordinary to not so good Italian restaurant with prices only a tourist could love. Caesar Salad was nothing but a plate of romaine lettuce tossed in vinegar and oil. No cheese, no anchovy. That my friends is not a Caesar Salad, that is a plate of romaine lettuce. Service was very attentive but rushed. Bread was so airy you could read the menu through it. Grilled chicken had to have been right out of a Sysco truck and we didn't have a good feeling about the restaurants cleanliness after using the washrooms.

GaGMMTquwRM2A76MdyRaCA.text: The food was quasi-so/so, but would have been forgivable if the service wasn't so crummy. Maybe it was an off night- but what a lousy first (and in my case) only impression to leave customers.

Yg9bjl3pAit4YtnYkmBNzQ.text: Do you enjoy being treated like sh!t?  Do you like it when a greasy illiterate "maitre 'd" insults you?  If so the Italian Ghetto is for you.

QlInQ0aN9P9B5o4xMd9Z-A.text: When you feel the urge to stop at the Italian grotto to get lunch , here is my recommendation : drive around a couple of blocks, stop at the gas station and flush $20 down the toilet and go home. You will feel exactly the same in either case - the gas station option is saves you time.  I returned from a trip to discover that they added a $10 as additional tip to my bill The service staff and the owner were  very unfriendly and they don't deserve a tip let alone an additional $10 They deserve to go out of business   Remember: flush $20 and go home

So-9JE-_0mp9evf1O-u-Cg.text: We too never got an opportunity to eat here.  After waiting at the door behind a party of 4 for about 5 minutes with no host or hostess I asked the party in front of us how long the wait was.  They said they did not know but had been waiting there for 10 mintues waiting to be greeted.    I decided to walk into the restaurant and look for some help.  I spotted a server and smiled and asked what the wait time was explaining that no one was there to greet us.  He looked as though he was going to help and started walking towards me and then past me and said they were busy.  No sorry someone will be right with you we are a little busy.  Just a rude curt get out of my way kind of attitude.    I walked right back to our party of four and said this place is rude let's get out of here.  We went to Bucca Di Beppo across the way and were greeted with big smiles and open arms.  The staff was amazing!  Shaken by my experience with the rude waiter I asked our waiter at Bucca to provide me with a duplicate receipt of our dinner bill.    I took the receipt back to Italian Grotto and wanted to speak to a manager explaining how they lost the business due to a rude waiter.  Well I never showed the receipt because again there was no host in the lobby so I proceed to walk into the restuarant to find the manager.  I was stopped by a halfbaked and drunk man with an empty bottle of wine in his hand in a gray shirt with gray hair and two diamond earrings in his ear.  He approached me and said you looking for someone.  I replied yes the owner or manager please.  He stood there and acted as though he were the person.  I asked are you the owner?  He said why are you asking me questions? I never asked you questions?  I turned to my friend and said they cannot be the owner.  I again asked and got the same response.    He ordered us out of the dining room and told us to talk to him on the tile area considered their tiny lobby.  I walked back and he was beligerent and drunk and proceeded to tell me that I was the rudest person he ever met.    Complete whackjob!  I agree that friends have to be writing these positive reviews.  Dick's Last Resort known to be rude on purpose posed as angels to this place.

KsaIHlSkwakKGhwQ0soTbA.text: Took friends here to dinner Friday night. The sword fish was wonderful, light, tender, meaty, excellent. $157 for 4 dinners plus 8 drinks (and they gave us after dinner lemon cello as well). Excellent value.

V6BVYyj33Z6ptHCuYIftFQ.text: Let me start by saying, I work in television. Specifically, I work on television shows that rip managers like the one here new assholes in front of millions of people. Say what you want about Kitchen Nightmares, Bar Rescue and Kitchen Impossible, but we take people like the manager that works here and kick them to the curb where lowlifes like her belong. The only thing I can say is I WISH we were shooting this bar so I could give this bitch what she deserves. The following is a detailed encounter with the WORST MANAGER I HAVE EVER SEEN IN MY CAREER. Skip to the second to last paragraph if you just want the punchline. I'll understand.   I'll set the scene for you: It's a Thursday night, my crew and I are on location working on said television show in Scottsdale. My boyfriend is from New York and we were looking to catch the Knicks game. Alas, we were pointed to "the best Italian joint in Arizona" by a neighboring bar owner. We walk on over and set up shop in a lovely little bar, we chat it up with the Bartender, TR, he's great, welcoming, from jersey, he even shares tales of the owner's history in New York. Everything is going swimmingly, what a great night out with friends, right? We order a few appetizers  bucket of clams, bucket of mussels and 3 light beers. All delicious. Atmosphere is beautiful, great old school music, just a great New Yorker's bar.   One of our guys is an HUGE Ucla fan so of course, he brought his Ipad with him so he could stream the UCLA game. This is where shit begins to quickly go south. My friend asks the TR if he could use the wireless to stream a little better. TR kindly directs us to a heavy set, dark haired woman bundled up like she's never been in weather below 80 degrees before. My friend kindly approaches her and asks if she's the manager. Her reply: "I don't work here".... hmmm My friend and I are perplexed... Well that strange because  TR just said you were the manager. My friend, confused, turned to TR assuming he must have asked the wrong woman. Nope, that was her and she just told us she didn't work here. Annoyed but polite, my friend leans over to her to get her attention and confront her about saying she didn't work here. He's joking with her at first, with a smile on his face. Her quip back to my friend, no lie this is what she said, "WHAT DO YOU WANT?". My friend is taken back by her aggressive nature and explains all he was going to ask was if he could use the internet. She aggressively tells him she doesn't know the password and walks to the end of the bar, yells over customers to TR (the nicest bartender on the planet) not to direct customers to her and if they want internet "THEY CAN PAY FOR 4G"* *Personal Note: Bitch, we have 4G.  We kept our mouths shut until we finished our drinks and food. Contemplated staying because the locals at the bar acknowledged the manager is known for being a bitch. TR was so great and welcoming and apologized for her behavior. Sadly, despite TR's attempt, we had to leave out of purpose alone. We close our tab, take care of TR because he's awesome and make our way to the door.   Before making our way completely out the door, my friend leans over to the manager and QUIETLY lets her know A) She's a terrible manager and B) we're leaving because of her. That's when she literally went Cat. 5-Batshit-Crazy on us. Screaming at my friend in front of the ENTIRE Restaurant, "DON'T POINT YOUR FINGER AT ME!!!" "IF YOU WEREN'T SO CHEAP TO PAY FOR 4G YOU WOULDN'T HAVE THIS PROBLEM" We let her know politely we're leaving and she's acting crazy to her reply, "LEAVE MOTHER FUCKERS!" Yep. She called us mother fuckers for asking if we could use the internet. "DON'T FUCKING COME BACK HERE YOU CHEAP ASSHOLES." Yep. That was another one that really stood out.   It's a shame. We roll with a crew of 60 people and every city we're in, we take over a local bar and restaurant for the 3 weeks we're in town. We understand the hospitality industry and we applaud great work and most of the time overlook bad behavior. I can honestly say I've never experienced such shocking behavior from anyone in the industry ever. I'm still completely blown away by how incredibly aggressive this woman was and how such a great place can employ such toxic behavior. I can say, despite TR's attempt to get us to come back, myself, nor anyone from our crew will bring business here while we're in town.   With Love,  K

Vv4yjTHyb835fdUq84qctQ.text: Stopped in for a drink and a quick break from sight-seeing an the sunshine. What a cool little place with a nice low-key, casual at-home feel. The owner was walking around talking to everyone and it seemed like a place I would find my whole family at. Didn't get to enjoy the food but it all looked and smelled delicious. Edmund is the best. Thanks for the great service!

Y_N6bKUWO9olYMS3kpLMxw.text: I read the reviews before we went in. I can tell you that the staff was very friendly including the owner. I read a lot of complaints about being treated rudely but we were treated very well.    I felt very rushed. Appetizers came out quickly and main course within a minute or two.  The food was mediocre at best. Not a place I would recommend or ever go back to.

VmVTSB-i5JWs-BC5IxVd7g.text: If i could give this place negative stars, I would. Not only did I not get greeted but was told to leave because I requested to sit outside when there were clearly tables available. Sorry if the geriatric Italian smell was not appealing but it was a beautiful evening in Scottsdale. Good luck with that customer service.

pbFUKEe1oD_lrGqiR4qA9Q.text: Being from New York I know what good Italian food is and this ladies and gentleman was not it. We saw the NY Yankees sign out front and decided this was the place to eat being away from home. First off when we walked in the owner who was also the host ignored my mother and I and asked my step dad the only man in our party where he wanted to sit. We were sat inside in the back it was quite and nice which was probably one of the only positives out of this experience. Our waiter Drew had to be on some form of narcotics because he was slurring his words and not standing correctly. My mother then ordered spaghetti meat sauce with a chicken cutlet on top and was charged for a chicken parm dinner. The other 2 chicken dishes were average. We also ordered drinks 2 beers and a terrible glass of wine. I think the dollar store sells better wine. Over all this was a terrible experience and we will never be back on our future visits to Arizona. Should have waited the half hour to eat at Grimaldi's about 2 blocks away. Better luck next time

6mjpfS4rXZQsA5YT0jgwew.text: WORST SERVICE EVER. Every single person we encountered was unfriendly and seemed very unhappy to be there. The menu sucks. Haven't even ate yet but I bet the food will suck too. 0/10 recommend unless you want to feel degraded the entire time.

pOoM-g_XRnQ5HtN7zkHKfQ.text: This is a great restaurant. Terrific food. Fun location in the heart of old town. But tonight (after coming here for more than 20 years) the service was AWFUL!!  Wait staff should check in with diners at least once in a while. At least keep drinks refilled and make sure all is ok after each course is delivered. Tonight we were totally ignored. No checking back at all. To add insult to injury, when the poor service was pointed out to both the owner and waiter they each argued with us. Busy night (and it wasn't). They were keeping an eye on the table even without asking if anything was needed (and it was needed and this nonverbal thing did NOT work). We got what we needed (owner brought drinks since waiter hadn't stopped by). What happened to customer service?!  And we heard both the waiter and owner arguing with other diners.

dTU3tnsNqCbnhxkB-P8Tig.text: Update: After leaving my recent review I decided to read the reviews of others and I am appalled by reports of the owner's actions and discrimination. It appears that the owner, Garry, now owns the new EAT West of Brown (old Cider Mill) near the Italian Grotto (scottsdaleaz.gov/Asset59...). I would strongly recommend avoiding this establishment if you, like me, do not condone this type of belligerent behavior. I created a Yelp account specifically to write this review to warn others not to eat at this restaurant. Our server was nice enough, but left part way through our service and the others didn't seem to care much, weren't helpful, and you can tell they don't like their job here. Ordered angel hair bolognese and had to ask our server if it had meat in it or if there was a mistake because there was so little of it. He did take the dish back after we asked this, but the second wasn't much better. Also ordered linguini with "white clam sauce" which ended up being pasta in a flavorless watery broth. Not only were these dishes nothing like what they were named, they did not taste good. For these prices ($100 for our dinner) I would strongly suggest that you spend your money elsewhere. There are so many other great options in Old Town.

aq7RTP0IO3vrwfXhya99_w.text: The worst service ever. Should get no stars. Waiters were rude and incompetent. Got our order wrong. Three of us has to eat so our food would not get cold while our fourth waited for the right order to come. Asked for bread numerous time and it never came. Food served warm not hot. I would not go back. Too many other really high quality restaurants in Scottsdale

HJCcN-T07uinuYBmuJjfBQ.text: If you want to know what to expect, please read this article about Gary Horowitz, the owner: phoenixnewtimes.com/rest... Went there the other night looking for a drink and he pretty much ensures you are going to have a horrible time before walking though the door. I'm from NY. I know how you're supposed to treat customers. This guy isn't even close, and if he hails from NY (as some here claim), it's probably a Long Island suburb. If you're out here for vacation, Spring Training, whatever, there is life outside of Old Town. Really want Italian? Go about a mile away to Pasta Brioni, who have legitimate New Yorkers running the place, not some schmuck in a Hawaiian shirt. pastabrioni.com

KAW5l1MRwpXkrTYwdttBMg.text: Can't go wrong with anything  at the Italian Grottoit is all good. Started out with calamari, than on to the house salad with a really good house dressing. Pasta with Bolognese sauce. The special that day was a halibut that was over the top. Spumoni ice cream and cappuccino's completed a really lovely lunch. Oh yes we will be back

-eOIffeh_sqVFwxaPlVQYA.text: I wish it was possible to give this place negative stars. Please avoid it at all costs and save your hard earned money and go to a decent restaurant. This place was filthy, food was below mediocre and overpriced, and worst of all, disrespectful owner with too much of an attitude. How can you get away with charging 21 dollars for a chicken caesar salad that seemed to be made with leftover chicken scraps, bagged lettuce, no croutons, and of the size of a side salad? I am a seasoned cook and foodie and eat out often, and by no means this is acceptable anywhere. Even when I used to live in NYC they would never get away with charging that, and if so, it would be in a top notch restaurant in the city.   The worst part was when my boyfriend's mom nicely requested a tad more cheese for her pasta and the owner almost dumped the whole cheese bowl in her plate! By no means should customers by treated in this manner. He was even eavesdropping our conversation and gave his input in regards to the subject. What kind of person in his/her right mind does this? In all, you are warned! Please don't come to this establishment.

mFKskJGXrx_YACGQnluxzQ.text: The rudest staff in the entire valley. Don't waste your money on this place. Will never ever return.

ip155BlfL5WjQqHI1X-NCQ.text: So where do I start. We are staying at the Hotel Valley Ho (Great Hotel). We wanted to support some local businesses since we are from Chicago and this place was down the street. We walked in and were seated right away as there were only 12 people in the place. So as we've been seated for 10 minutes we have no clue what to order drink/ appetizers since we had no menu. I ordered a PBR draft and received a Laguanitas. Didn't want to be difficult and do love Laguanitas, but was looking for a domestic on draft.   Finally we receive our menus and order a appetizer, which was decent. We order full meals complimented by a soup or salad. 4 of the 6 of us order soup, needless to say the Minestrone soup came out cold. We push all soup to the middle of the table and the owner screams at the waiter, at this point we don't want soup. So we ask for salads instead, the owner took our soups threw them back in the pot and tried re-serve them back to us. We all decided at this point to not eat them. So our meals come at which point I'm sketchy about, they were somewhat decent. All around bad vibe there, average service, hillbilly drunks hanging at the bar, gross ASS bathrooms, and a horrible owner as he counts his money at the front door before customers leave and its closing time. Bill for our group of 6 was $200! DON'T Spend your money here, I'm sure there's  better.

IiukjQNKNffHZ4cUcG52BA.text: This was the worst dining experience I have ever had. The owner is the rudest man I have ever met. The service is terrible. "Meatball" was so rude. The blond woman was also rude. I  now see many people have had this experience. How is it still open?  I should of read the yelp reviews! Stay away from this place!!!!! Zero stars!!!

DiBUwnVkUIzrJi-BCmxu9Q.text: Food was average but the service was the worst. We went in with a group of 5 and the server suggested garlic toast for the table. When we got the bill he had generously ordered us 2 orders of garlic toast at 7$ each. So bread that is usually free at most Italian restaurants was as much as a meal. When we asked about it on the bill he became rude and very aggressive. We will never go back.

z9s-r9eQhvJXCmA_O-T0rw.text: Do not call this place Italian.  It is disgusting.  The owner is a pompous ass as is his wait staff.  Generally rude, and condescending .  Lots of foot traffic but everyone walked right by. They clearly were in the know.  Do not waste your money when there are so many awesome places there.  We ate outside and heat lamps and paraphananalia just thrown there.  Yuk!!!!!  We should have read the reviews before we went.

Vut_rwl0V1RlB-hTgZy9QQ.text: Old school Italian in Old Town Scottsdale!  Loved the relaxed atmosphere, sports memorabilia on the walls and homemade spaghetti & meatballs...YUM.  No slick corporate millennial vibe needed here.  I'll be back!!!

OEnUTasfNz8GhK6-dgZV-A.text: The prices are a little high but this place is old fashioned, yummy, and has the east coast/Italy vibes! This is a great family place and I would definitely go back with my parents. I like how the meals come with a salad too, that's always a plus! Definitely give this place a try!

GCBYdlvNj_C1_0H7Nv3QJA.text: Do not go here if you want to be treated kindly!!!! My husband and I were enjoying our Scottsdale staycation.  We had been up and down the Old Town Scottsdale, done some wine tasting, had lunch.  Overall just enjoying our couples time.  As we were coming up on this restaurant, I said I need to use the restroom and then we can settle down and have a drink and get a snack at the bar.  I walked in and started to head straight to the bathroom. The owner chased me down, yelling at me that the bathroom is for paying customer only, I said I plan on going to the bar once I use the restroom, he yelled at me to get out.  At this point I am completely confused on what is happening I look up and some big fat guy (MEATBALL-Seems awful proud of a name that means dull, stupid or foolish) and says I need to leave.  My husband is as stunned as I am and he is trying to figure out what the heck is going on.  I just turn around say ok, and then tell the owner he is a douchebag they literally chased us out the door.  I still have no idea what happened.  This took place in a restaurant full of people.  I might have been embarrassed if I wasn't so shocked by what happened.  I called later to complain about the treatment and Meatball said everything had been recorded and I was now officially harassing them!  When I looked this place up on Yelp, I see this is a common occurrence. The owner needs to sober up (it was pretty clear he had too much to drink) and get a clue, you cannot continue to treat people so poorly and stay in business.

BjzOL-Hexm3PhBn_c7-v8g.text: AMAZING food. Great location with an incredibly authentic feel. My wife and I followed our waiter's recommendation and it was well worth it. I can't think of words to describe how great this place is for a nice quiet date.   I would recommend you ignore these bad reviews. The waiters are charismatic and I'm guessing these people have thin skin. Their charm is half the fun. Same with my barber shop: all the bad reviews are people who don't have personality. I'll be back many more times

zoIRi585wEnkcz082aFkPw.text: How can a waiter/bartender at an Italian restaurant NOT know what pasta aglio e olio is??  Murphy, at the bar didn't. I ordered the chicken parm work the pasta aglio e olio and he gave me confused look and said "huh????"  I explained it to him and he said,  "so you want chicken parm with no marinara?"  No!  Chicken parm comes with marinara,  i want the chicken parm as usual,  i want the pasta aglio e olio.  When he brought it out the pasta wad loaded with marinara.  He told me he had the cooks add the marinara on top of the olive oil.    Not knowing what aglio e olio is in an Italian restaurant is like not knowing what fries ate in a burger joint.    The food was ok, minestrone soup wad kind of bland, entree wad actually decent,  even with the fiasco. I would not go back

fKPG3RsFhQmkNrbcwvnxjQ.text: Free bathrooms if you bring hand sanitizer and your running shoes   I'm walking through town with my yoga pants and a pink t-shirt reading "love yourself." I love me some chicken parmigiana and red wine so I thought this would be a great spot for lunch while I wait to check into my hotel. Like a responsible single lady I wanted to use the restroom before settling in to the empty bar....the facility was so filthy I didn't even lock the door or wash my hands.   Wondering what the kitchen must be like I decided there was no way I was eating there. A drink? Still maybe...nobody was tending the bar as I walked up so I started to leave. A blonde woman appeared out of nowhere and asked what she could get me to which I replied "oh nothing thank you." She then blasted me for just wanting to use the restroom. She's been in old town long enough and knows my game. I just was like ok and walked out.   10 feet down the street I'm assuming Gary the owner yells "I hope the rest of your day is honest!" I turned around and said honestly I'm just not feeling this place. He continued to yell verbal insults as I walked my fine ass down the street.   Went to the Grapevine, had a great lunch and 3 Moscow mules. Very clean bathroom to boot. Going back tonight for their chicken parm and karaoke night because that place doesn't suck.   Yankees suck. The Grotto sucks. Either go out of business or be a star on Kitchen Nightmares. Yuck.

dOEwezskMX41Ngo48oKMRg.text: Doogie the bartender is a below average, narcissistic, weed reeking, homophobic, racist, looser working dead end jobs in his 60's because he can't actually achieve shit in life. Oh and your drinks suck. Can't even make a decent vodka cranberry. I use to work here with him and he was nothing but a prick. He thinks he knows everything you need to know about anything. I will say most of the other staff where nice to work with. Gary, if you see doogie on the side of the road anytime soon give him a HUGE fuck you from me! lMJnaxqR7PwjZSJG4gbUug.text: I think this is one of my worst experiences eating out in Scottsdale. The waiter was part of what made the experience bad.  My friend and I ate lunch around 2pm on a sunny afternoon 10.27.18. After seating us outside, I didn't get a napkin. I had to get up and get one off another table. Then our water came. My glass was dirty, so I asked for another one. He never refilled my water until the meal was over. I refilled my glass several times.  Everything on the menu was pasta. I'm trying to loose weight so I wanted a salad. All I saw was ceasar salads with chicken,  salmon or shrimp.  I ended up ordering a salad with oil and vinegar dressing with the salmon. What a waste. It came with plain lettuce and salmon for $16!!  Don't waste your money or time here, go somewhere else.

sBtWmXgt0vTS7s8aurCCIg.text: What an experience for only the short amount of time we were here. We waited at the front door for the server to pass us twice before saying someone will be right with you. Come to find out the owner is sitting at the bar getting drunk before waiting on the customers trying to spend money. After a few more minutes he decides to come seat us and he is wearing open toed flip flops with his ferocious toe nails showing. Yuck, in a restaurant?   Tried to let it pass but we got to the table and were forced with "we are old, it's really good food." Took one look at my silverware and realized it was dirty.  You won't believe what's next!!! The silverware was picked up by the owner dipped into a water pitcher and then wiped on the table in front of us... as if this cleans things. Of course the silverware was returned to us.   I am still not sure why we didn't leave yet, maybe it was because he was over our shoulders yelling at his waitress and told her to mind her own business and get inside. Once he turned the corner we booked it. Full sprint and yeah... I wouldn't take my worst enemy there. Thanks good luck!

bzfshyTx1KOeQJd6nXjXfw.text: Worst treatment ever. I do not if it was a waiter or the owner, an old guy in a black shirt. Shouted at me GET THE HELL OUT OF HERE.  You are asking too many questions whenI have said YES you stop asking questions. Question No 1. May I use your bathrom? He said yes. I commented my friend outside talking on her cell. We will eat lunch here. Question no 2 what type of food do you serve here?  Twice shouting " GET THE HELL OUT HERE" Twice in front of the costumers.

WyZm7KW9lOXZp25rnQ1HLA.text: Retro Chic with fantastic, homemade food, generous portions, incredible prices. Handcrafted piccata sauce is incredible over chicken, halibut, salmon and more. A ribeye to rival the best. Handmade spumoni puts others to shame. Friendly, fun servers with dynamic personalities and expert recommendations. Full bar, delicious wine selections with generous pours. Comfortable, fun atmosphere. A must-visit in old town Scottsdale. Baseball fans welcome here!!

KDoAE8QIQM__iZbPMDzImQ.text: Congratulations Grotto you set a new low for me.   Don't ignore the low ratings here and the stories of a psychotic manager.   I ordered the ribeye special and requested it medium rare. When it came out well done, I asked for the waiter. Then the manager, aka psycho, comes over and starts yelling at me! No ownership, no offer to make it better. He was threatening ME because THEY ruined the steak.   The slogan of this place seems to be: "We are the Grotto, go fuck yourself."  There are so many great restaurants in Scottsdale. Don't make the mistake of eating at this overrated dump with Mr. bad manners and his meth head unpredictability.

pFycpnCYntRAbmmwv90zdQ.text: Its a shame how bad this place has become.  We went there for the firat time 15 years ago when we first moved to scottsdale and it was a great dining experience and great food.  We have been back a couple of times over the years to try to recapture that experience and it unfortunately, no matter how hard we try to enjoy it just gets worse and worse the food and the help.        We went last night, and it was busy, and we were seated right away to their credit, and a nice booth too, felt great about it, even ordered some drinks that we were not planning on having but wanted to show some gratitude for the nice quick seating.       We ordered our food and it was all downhill, it took a long time and they messed up my wifes salad and as i was eating the soup i had to wonder when it was made.  You kind of get the feeling they may not be doing so well and expect gordon ramsey to jump up at any moment and tell everyone to stop eating and hes closing the kitchen.      Now the fun part, so we keep waiting for our food, waiting waiting, my wife says this is enough and we get up to leave, i was preparred to pay for the drinks and salad and soup, preparred to overpay actually, and like something out of a bad movies as they saw us getting up came over and slammed our food on the tables as if to say "ha we beat you before you could leave#       We took one bite of the food and it was not good and we ordered expensive dinners, we informed the waiter that we were not enjoying it had taken one bite and wanted to leave.  He told us without even asking anything that we had made a verbal agreement with the establishment and if we left he would call the police.  Wow!  We were not trying to get out on our bill .. just a ridiculous way to handle that situation, then the owner came over and started yelling at us and telling us off.        So we ended up paying $120 for a side salad and cup of soup and 2 beers.  The food us so bad we didnt even eat it and just left it.        The waiter did come up and apologize before we left which was nice it was obvious to anyone around that they were out of line, and the owner made some smart ass comment as we left.        If it was 15 years ago id highly recommend it, your money will be terribly wasted there now days and will probably result in one of the worse dinning experiences you will ever have which usually ends in a bad rest of the night with your significant other if you now what im talking about.      Way to many other great choices to eat at in that area, stay away from this place you will thank me.

TCihkFPK19AmsWKkffd56g.text: I can't believe this nasty place is still open. I beg anyone to please read all the reviews below. You will see consistent and repeated mentioning of a rude and disrespectful owner and argumentative and dishonest waiters.   This was so True. We were actually told to leave. They threaten to call the police if we didn't. Can you believe that? Never in my life has this happened. This place needs to be shut down now.  Please do not go and give this sorry place another dime.  Buyer BEWARE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I promise, if you go, you will be disappointed.

j6-6dj4fvFO9f__Xgy50pg.text: If I could give this place ZERO stars I would. We went out as a family (2 adults+2 children over the age of 8), we came up to this place looking for dinner. It was one of the few places that had availability. My husband went in to find out if there was a wait. The person at the front said no wait, so he came back out to get us and when the old guy who worked there saw we had kids said he didn't have any seating for us. He said no kids allowed. I could not believe this! Never in my life has this ever happened to me! I have never been  turned away for dinner because I had kids. This is a new low. This is DISCRIMINATION and I believe against the law. This place should be closed. I would NEVER give this scum bag my money. I can't comment on the food as we obviously never ate there.

WELkDm_QEMcgycZgOvVnIQ.text: I have to admit, I am using the Yelp star rating less and less - and the Italian Grotto is a perfect example of why.  When in Scottsdale a few weeks ago I asked a couple long time residents working at Don & Charlies where else they suggest going for dinner when I was coming back in a couple weeks with my wife.  2 of the 3 mentioned the Italian Grotto as another old school Scottsdale place with local flavor and good food.  Checking the Yelp reviews it seems a lot of people have bad service.  What I have found is that I rarely get bad service, so I always discount those reviews.  So I went ahead and made a reservation for the following Saturday night after our Spring training game.  I am glad I did.    In summary - we were seated at the time of our reservation, the waiter was great (well spoken, friendly, informative, and prompt), our table was good, the food/wine was very good, and the prices fairly reasonable.  I would recommend this place, except maybe during the 3rd weekend of Spring Training (the busiest weekend).  More details follow ... Due to an incident my wife had at the ball game, I called in the afternoon and asked if we could move the reservation back from 7:00 to 8:00 pm - the gruff sounding owner answered and took care of it.  We showed up at 7:45 to find a line of people waiting.   I slipped past them and waited patiently for someone to assist me - they were very busy so it took a few minutes.  Finally the owner came by, I mentioned the reservation, and he confirmed we would be seated shortly.  Meanwhile several people in line were glaring at me and made comments to my wife about me "cutting in line".    The owner was seating the first family in line when 3 guys brushed past everyone, walked in, looked around, and sat at an empty table by the bar area.  When the owner saw that he asked them to move since the table was for people waiting in line.  We could see the discussion from the door and the entitled young men were not leaving easily.  The men finally got up and stood in the bar area right by the same table.    Starting to see a trend here?  A few minutes later the owner motioned to the next couple in line and seated them at that table,  He then motioned to us and sat us in a booth nearby.  As we were being seated, there were more comments from those waiting in line who had no reservations - "how come they got a table", etc.  People - make a f'ing reservation!  From our small booth we could see the front dining room and bar area as well as into the back dining room.  The place was packed with every table filled.  Service was humming and our waiter gave us the proper amount of attention.  We could see the 3 guys who were evicted from the table they illegally claimed - they were standing right next to the table and bumping the woman who was seated at the table.  She eventually moved to the other side of the table.  There were many other examples of poor behavior by customers that I won't bother you with.  Our waiter gave us recommendations on the wine and food - we listed to some of them and were not disappointed.  The food we got was delicious.  The wine was perfect.  The service was good.  The waiter answered all of our questions and was quite helpful.  At the end of the night I showed him my wallet - a cool one my wife found in NY years ago that has an old picture of downtown Scottsdale.  Our waiter identified the buildings on it for us and pointed out that the edge of the restaurant was right at the edge of the picture.  He knew the area well and grew up around there.  So in summary, it would have been a wonderful night if it weren't for the entitled people who came to Scottsdale for Spring training that think they can do what they want, eat at busy restaurants with out reservations, and be rude to others because as one guy that night put it "I spent over $1000 to come here for the weekend."  So I would highly recommend coming here - I would just avoid the middle of March - when to bozos come out to play.  I rate the 4.5 stars - rounding up to 5 to slightly counteract the "bad service" reviews by people who seem to attract bad service.

C7XI14aiqzI69XHYD24sjQ.text: Went downtown Scottsdale with visiting family. Wanted something besides tacos. Stopped in this corner restaurant for some Italian. Walked in and was greeted by owner Garry H.  Brought us to a table and I asked our visitors if this seating was Ok?  The table was in middle of restaurant and a little crowded together. I always ask my guests as a courtesy. Garry looked at me and said "why are you asking them?  This is where you are sitting and if you don't like it too bad". I was stunned. Thought maybe we should go somewhere else. Then I observed that this is just his rude personality. Another customer politely asked for her check. He looked at her and said "if I have to give you your check I'm going to make something up and you won't like it. ??? If you want to be treated rudely this is your place.  Oh and by the way food was ok but not something to warrant a second visit.

SlzVQO5vIY1Ws5bvbaUvig.text: Read the reviews this place is a nightmare. Seriously, in a world where you can preview a restaurant before subjecting yourself to it you have no excuse if you ignore the warnings. This place is overly expensive, disgusting and the service is garbage. The owner seems like he might have some mental health issues- for which i have no judgement I'm just warning you. He's crass, loud and his wild, wide eyes are terrifying. We witnessed him scream, yes, scream at staff and customers alike. The silverware is caked with food. That's not even an exaggeration. There is literally dirty silverware on the tables. It would be better to dig old pasta from the trash behind an Olive Garden than to attempt a meal at this dump.

KoSc3Su-Y84NvCLpqnbIxQ.text: The host was very rude.  The area where they tried to stuff 10  people was claustrophobic. The bartender actually told me this area is for me not for you! When I asked him do you speak to all your customers that way; The effing moron have the balls to tell me I'm sorry you're having a bad day. I was I having a great day until I walked up to the shit hole restaurant that serves Chef Boyardee frozen food. What an absolute shit hole

rAGHTW0hyP4XKhnIlzsA4Q.text: Terrible service, mediocre Italian food and over priced food for small portions. Don't waste your time in Old Town coming to the Italian Grotto, there are so many more great restaurants in the area!

g8N9aJtroUhtKI2yEui3UA.text: We went on a Thursday before Art walk. We were greeted by the owner and thought this is goi to be great. We sat outside on the very corner of the sidewalk close to the street. Very interesting mix of cars people etc. THAT WAS THE HIGH POINT.    Veal dish and Chicken Piccata were not good. Veal was tough and chewy. Noodles with piccata were smothered in olive oil. Calimari was tasteless and the sauce that came with it tasted like it came out of a can.   Waiter was indifferent.  What a waste if what started as a fun meal.

1HEm54FmJ9ztLLfbVNskXg.text: Food was great, service was great.  Owner was incomprehensible.  Yelled at small children.  Brought our family to tears.  I would never go back and advise anyone reading this to avoid the restaurant.

f0Uz4koA-3flaZ5EIIhCGQ.text: TERRIBLE SERVICE. I was eating and watched one of the servers YELL at an elderly man for "being messy". I am absolutely disgusted with this and can't imagine how a restaurant like this stays open. Do not give them business. We will never go back.

eSZEBF2Z1T7SBSEAnOIf3A.text: Not worth the money for kind of service  Food Ok  If you are a tourist don't be a victim in this restaurant

7qpQ3QpUCTdyROYcrVnrfw.text: The owner of this restaurant is a horrible person.  He yelled at young children for using the restroom and brought my little girl to tears.  He didn't care when confronted about it and said he didn't mind if we posted a negative review on Yelp and Facebook.  Any adult who yells at children is a poor excuse for a human. M5tpleOMgooTxB9qXa9uYw.text: Had a great meal at the Grotto on July 4th Not crowded and the food was very fresh and delicious

Q7Kf-SkjGJGdiogfmnXyKg.text: Came in here on Parada del Sol to grab a quick bite. They were fairly busy but we were seated immediately. Nice atmosphere and the staff all seem very helpful to eachother. Almost like they've all been part of this team for a long time. Terence was our server and was just fantastic. He knows the menu very well and his suggestions were spot on. I had the spaghetti and meatballs, sister had Chilean sea bass with spinach ravioli and friend had chicken piccata. All of it fabulous. The bread and butter were awesome too. The salad dressings are so freaking good. I got house italian with blue cheese. Yumtown! The salad was fresh,cold and came with marinated onions of some sort. We all just loved it. The owner came over and said hi and really made us feel like we were regulars.....and I'm thinking we just might be.

nabvfH8l-BqMcRuQN4FSoA.text: Went just last night. No lie 28 dollars for 4 ravioli. Yes they were good but lukewarm and not enough for that ridiculous price. Bradley was waiter but didn't serve the food angry wait staff dropped in front of us. So many nice places to eat. I would not waste my time. Wish I would have thought to snap photo of the 4 lonely ravioli...

WC5SLEFsHxmdPvRdxoP_3g.text: How many times have I passed this place since I have lived in the valley? About a million? I always said, one day I am going there. Well today I did, and I am so glad!!! Girls impromtu lunch today, so glad I was feeling pasta!! We walked in and were greeted by a fantastic gentelman with a very New York accent. Awesome! As soon as we sat down we knew that this was one cool place. We had a group of servers taking care of us, no pretense here! Loved the ambiance! The food, was oh so fantastic! Can't wait to go and try other dishes. This place is great as a first date night. Like I said not a lot of pretense, so some of that pressure is gone;)  Who care if the menus are not laminated, the food made up for that. So going back!!

tg_lcj_TEE2tfHrWI-RQhw.text: If you are looking for authentic Italian with a great right-on-the-corner atmosphere look no further than The Grotto (and by that I mean stop wasting your money at Bucca).  My absolute favorite on the menu is the chicken parmesan. The cut is lean and fried to perfection, topped with delicious mozzarella and served with pasta with "tastes like it was made back East" red sauce.

9w6X3CO6LrjbYp-KtgRfPw.text: Probably one of the greatest Italian spots i have been too. Food is awesome, staff is friendly and attentive. Good atmosphere. Menu is pretty extensive and wine list is good as well. Nice place for a romantic dinner with someone special, low lights and good music!

BfoYxhu8qZ1XZvphFkBdBg.text: I once experienced this lovely little Italian place on the corner-and I return again, and again. The service here is always excellent.  The music, ambiance, and big booths are fantastic.  Everything here always tastes fresh and perfect! My favorite is the chicken picatta, is yum-yum delicious! (Clam buckets for appetizers are also a giant plus!)

ATgQ7ddGqs3uehZhB6qCAg.text: WOW!  If you want to be treated terrible, yelled at, and spit on by the wait staff and owner this is the place to go.  I can elaborate on the spitting part - while the owner Gary was yelling drunk he spit while he talked....  I was excited to to this place after all the yelp reviews, but unfortunately was completely disappointed.  Its amazing they are even in business with the way they treat their customers!

P70Hscf0wweT6uowHFd9CA.text: Italian Grotto must me doing something right if it's been in business for 30 YEARS +. If you can cant handle different personalities than your own, this place isn't for you. The owners and some of their employees are from the east coast, so be prepare to heckled, but in a joking and fun way.  Now to get down to the food. I must say that in my opinion,  Italian Grotto has the best Italian Food in Town (as far as Scottsdale goes). My husband and I discovered this gem just walking around Old Town Scottsdale. Luckily for us, we were in for a great surprise! As a newbie, we played it safe and ordered the Spaghetti with meat sauce. I never thought something so simple could be so good!! Along with your meal you get fresh baked bread with sun dried tomato butter, fresh salad with homemade dressing. Be careful not to fill up on bread before your meal comes, although its hard not too especially if you get an order of small clams or muscles portofino (white whine garlic butter sauce). Since the past 2 years i have tried enough entrees that i have narrowed it down to two favorite's..... White lasagna, and the Linguine with Clam Portofino! Don't forget dessert! Their Tiramisu is AMAZINGLY good! I have nothing but good things to say about this place. The staff are quick on their feet and aim to please! This place will be a long time favorite of mine!

pRSKFn7JFwNUaVBrk1pwOg.text: By far the WORST dining experience I have ever had. I have never been treated more rudely. Came here today with my family to have a nice lunch while out shopping in Old Town. Three of my family members ordered the Baked Ravioli, I ordered the Manicotti, and two others got Fettucini Alfredo, and Spaghetti with Marinara. We were not given any bread, so we ordered some garlic toast for $6. Each of our lunch plates cost $8 each, and were a la carte. When our food came out, everything looked fine except for the ravioli. There were literally 4 pieces of ravioli on one plate. 4 small pieces of ravioli for $8. That's not enough food for one person. We had to make an extra order of the garlic toast for another $6 so the ones who ordered ravioli could have some extra food. I got two pieces of Manicotti, which was okay. My sister was upset, and decided to talk to management about the portion sizes. The owner of the restaurant came out, started YELLING, and saying that she didn't care, and that if she comped meals of everyone who complained to her, she'd be out of business. WOW. My sister said that they should make people aware of how many pieces of ravioli come on the plate, and she said, "We never tell people that. You guys actually got two pieces of Manicotti and you were only supposed to get one, so that should make up for it." We were all very calm, and she kept raising her voice and being completely rude. She doesn't care about customer service. My family was visiting from out of town and this was our last day to spend together. We were just trying to have a nice lunch. We weren't asking for a refund, we just thought it would be nice if they could give more ravioli to the ones who ordered that, or at least comp the garlic toast we had to order just to give us more food. We paid $80 for that meal and everyone was still hungry when we left! They also told us after the fact that they normally give free bread before the meal, but they didn't do it for us. I have never been treated so rudely or had an experience like this before, especially not from the owner of the restaurant. I've eaten at plenty of restaurants in Old Town Scottsdale and never had an experience like this. I guess I will stick with Grimaldi's that's right down the road. Better food, and better portions, and the staff and owners are friendly and care about their customers and repeat business. Diana, you should be ASHAMED of yourself and the way you run your restaurant. That's exactly why on the day after Christmas, at the lunch hour, that your restaurant was mostly empty. The food wasn't even good enough for the prices you are charged. I've had better food at Olive Garden, and that's sad.

NfUyaMgxNoAfMlyH_8tTzA.text: Honestly I really do enjoy the food here because of how delicious it always has been but, it was my first Mother's Day with my son ... With another baby on the way only a month along ... I walked up to the host stand with my stroller ... Talked to a waitor and he said one moment then afterwords ... An older man with slicked back greasy hair walks up, slurping down water slamming it down and asked what it was I was doing ... I then proceeded to tell him I had been helped ... I honestly didn't know whom he was because he was sloppy and was not dressed as a host would be, anyways he then proceeds to be rude and tell me "your gonna something and move out of the way" and I looked at him as my blood pressure and hormones levels went up... The. Again says " don't look at me like that I have 5 daughters don't be mad at me " .... I literally have him a look but Honestly what business owner speaks to customers like that. My mother finally arrived to find me even more disturbed ... My 11 month old needed a high hair and they only have ONE... Not kid friendly at all!!! They made me feel uncomfortable for having to out my child in his stroller! Needless to say they have the table next to me the highchair and never offered it to me after the last person had used it!!! It ruined my dinner all together! My mother knew who I was talking about when I explained what had happened because this man whom apparently is from Chicago/ New York is a jackass to all his customers and even has had the nerve to tell others to turn there cell phones off as my mother explained that happened over spring training ... Just a side note from one New Yorker to another you make all of us look bad with your poor attitude ... You don't like your job get a new one!!! I didn't even want to spend my money at your establishment and your lucky my pregnant hormonal ass was craving your food or else I would have given you a True New Yorkers attitude ... I will never step foot in there after this experience .... If you have children I would advice not to go there as well!

-mwJh2qarQol_eWRLwUMJQ.text: Food was good.  Portions were small.  Not the cleanest retaurant I've ever been in.

rGT2ptS0B-3tMgE1lk9dWw.text: I had a great experience at Italian Grotto a couple weeks ago. I love the atmosphere of the restaurant. It feels very authentic. I love how most of the servers are older (maybe Italian?) men who aren't afraid to be a little loud and outlandish. Our server made great suggestions. The food was really good. I had halibut- piccata style. My boyfriend had shrimp parmesan which he said was also good. I haven't found very many legit Italian places in Phoenix so I'm glad I finally went here.

xEskunvUq6RezDt4koeRag.text: Outstanding Italian food in Old Town tonight.  We started with a antipasto and calamari - both good enough to get us excited about the entrees.  The Chicken Parmigiana and Shrimp Scampi were incredible.  I doubt you could go wrong with anything on the menu.  Definitely a leisurely pace and couldn't be farther from a chain restaurant.  Fresh ingredients, an outstanding menu and authentic charm make this a local favorite.

wdJkOn22FyguvegvxMmVVg.text: What can I say....It's kinda one of those places you either "get" or you don't.....I get the employees...They aren't stuffy...they aren't fancy....It's an Italian "hang-out" if you will......To me, they make you feel like your family.  I love the food, especially any seafood special they can cook up!  The minestrone soup doesn't look like much, but OMG...it's good!  My hubby had veal the other night, and it was good....to much breading for my taste, but it was still really good.  All in all.....Can't wait to go back....Hope to see ya soon Italian Grotto boys! Carol  Old School Chico Ca.

WkIlXEC9e7xzTR-fh_oUAQ.text: Without a doubt, the Italian Grotto has the best atmosphere in Old Town for a meal, and doesn't make you feel like you're in Scottsdale at all. Cozy and full of life every time I've been, the Italian Grotto has a pretty good wine and beer list, as well as some amazing food.  WARNING: Don't fill up on bread! From favorites (and my favorite) Manicotti, to my boyfriends favorite Chicken Carolina, the Italian Grotto has a wide variety of entrees on their menu (which look like they are falling apart, but I don't mind!) that do not disappoint. The Manicotti was melt in your mouth good, and the extra cheese they put on top was like icing on the cake.  The waiters are always super nice and helpful, and the last time we walked in, the owner showed us to our table personally, which you rarely get at restaurants these days! When the weather is nice out, they open their side doors and push the tables out a little, so you can sit out and enjoy the air and people watch.  This is not really a place you'd want to go when you're looking for a quiet, intimate meal, but the dim lighting and cozy tables can feel quite romantic. If there's a game on, all bets are off though! We went there during March Madness and it was pretty noisy until the game was over (which we didn't mind, we actually came to watch the end of the game).   If I had to pick a place for Italian food in the Valley, the Italian Grotto would definitely be it.

965Lmv7lMF5SqVfJoRAx_Q.text: The manager or owner was rude to our group of six and insulted me personally.  We asked if there would be an outside table for six.  We saw that there was a party finishing up their meal.  His response was this: "Do you see any tables open for six? You need to be visual.  It doesn't take any intelligence at all to be visual"  I responded that he didn't obviously need our business and his response was, "Go annoy someone else."  As we moved on to another place he moved over to an outside ashtray, picked up a half-smiked cigarette and lit it up. How this place stays open with this ignorant character as the face of the business is beyond me.

MuDBQG-K-S3Wts46HuBHvg.text: Can I give negative stars?  My boyfriend and I went into this restaurant for a drink while walking through old town. We were welcomed in and told that there were 2 seats at the corner of the bar. We sat and asked them what their on drink selection was. Since they were all over priced and we were just stopping by for a drink while we explored the area we ordered a beer each. I accidently bumped into a customer that was wedged in the corner eating dinner when I went to sit in the high top chair. I apologized to her and quickly we started up a conversation with this couple that was in their 50's. The manager rushes over asks the couple if they would like to move... okay weird. They said no. I wasn't trying to intrude on their meal or anything and they did seem interested in the conversation. As I turn back to the bar the bartender slaps our tab on in front of us. He said "here's your check please pay and leave." I said "Excuse me" and he responded "You are a waste of space at my bar." I was shocked! Never have I been treated like that or basically kicked out of a bar. I have worked in customer service my entire life and I definitely do not deserved to be treated like trash. I became infuriated as I responded "are you serious?" All he said was "Leave" and walked away from us. My boyfriend said, "Let's just get out of here. This place sucks anyway." As we walk out I see the manager as he ushers us towards the door and I told him what happened and he said "I'm sure this isn't the first time that you have been kicked out of somewhere!" WHAT!!!!!! Seriously?! What sparked all of this? I like to have a good time, I am social, I love a good drink and great food! WHAT THE HELL! NEVER in my life have I ever been kicked out of somewhere and I cannot even begin to understand why I was kicked out of this restaurant bar. For god sakes it is an italian restaurant with carpeting! Yuck and the manager or owner what ever he is such a d-bag!  Plus he appeared to be drunk or on drugs or something. Such a weird, trying to be sauve, high on something, wanna be al pacino presence. How do you run a business like this and survive? I however cannot comment on the food since I will NEVER EVER go back there, but with such horrible discriminating service who would ever go there?! Save yourself the aggravation and do not help this jerk prosper with your hard earned money. What a fake establishment! They welcome you in to the bar from the street and then kick you out? Very questionable service to me.

pf_S5SR0UkBFFhVk4_-OKA.text: Food was great, unfortunately the staff left much to be desired.   Given the rest of the choices in the area though, it's best to opt for good food and bad service.

8hYMccMy8LuirYBfWWfjLQ.text: The host (possible the manager) was extremely rude. I tried to eat lunch here with my kids today. I understand that some restaurants aren't for kids, but the manager waved his hand in my face and said "I am not feeling this!". I said "We can eat outside" and he said "You don't understand. I am not going to seat you." He was so rude that the group behind me said that they wouldn't eat there. All he had to say was that the don't serve kids or they could have posted it somewhere.

vp8iLNs9dVi2jvYAs9lbQg.text: I don't typically leave reviews, but the host/owner was sarcastic and rude before we could even get our name on the list. Needless to say we took our business across the street.

J4j9JiaD8H9y5pRXqa7scA.text: Had a bottle of wine and a very small plate of Calimari on the patio yesterday.  The wine was good and the Calimari was acceptable. -cJr9prGMPOoDA_eQZEexw.text: Never EVER have been treated this way by a restaurant manager/owner(?) & server no better! My husband & I always share and we asked for suggestions from waiter. Took him up on the Chilean Sea Bass. We were very hungry and ate it tho salt was the primary flavor. Our friend ordered a dish with capers but it was inedible. Needless to say, the ruckus was over the top & we were aghast! With all the good choices around, we really were treated like garbage!

We got right in asked for a gluten free menu. We were asked what we wanted to drink just as we sat down and we said waters for now. The owner then replied that he was not going to serve us and asked us to leave. xMqAsKxKW67V3igu2lLkKA.text: Just spoke to the manager Brandon about my order to ask if it was correct. Told me to call back because it was to busy and couldn't answer my question and said never come back.  This is horrible customer service especially from a manager!  Never order from here or even try to call to ask a question because the managers won't make time.

ibsmXkGu5EAvBj_66ZO4oQ.text: This restaurant looks like it belongs on the show Bar Rescue.   We were in old town late last night and looking for a place to eat. My father-in-law decided we step in to try the place. First impressions: The place is extremely dated and has an odd artsy/Italian feel. The waiting staff was nice and had good attitudes but they looked sloppy; shirts untucked, baggy clothing, etc. Our table was wobbly but our waiter got down on his hands and knees to put some towels under it to balance it out..  The menus need some refreshing and updating. We were handed paper menus with food stains and torn edges. The prices were ridiculous. Most entrees ranged from 21-34. We all ordered pasta, which was mediocre at best, and a whopping $14 per plate. I get that it's Scottsdale but come on, I could get far better tasting food at Olive Garden.  There was a gentleman sitting at the bar who I'm guessing to be the owner? Having a little much to drink, he was talking loud and flirting with customers while ordering drinks and refilling water glasses. Several employees were babysitting him during our visit attempting to control him. We won't be back.

LZ0QkhyIHveoZ4uJDzspRg.text: We went there during the summer time which is like and off season for that side of town. The ambiance is just horrible there. Its too dark and the color scheme is bad. The food is literally nasty and is way overpriced. I don't even remember who waited on us because they were never around to ask how was the food or a refill.  This place needs to get Chef Gordon Ramsey to help them out. LOL!

Q3ciyZKFOUFZDVr_1CkRyQ.text: Had a great time with my wife at The Grotto. Food was great and Garry, the owner was gracious. Doogie the bartender was great. Made a ass kicking martini. If you are ever in Old Town Scottsdale, make sure you eat at the Italian Grotto. You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Italian Grotto - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

JUvA73rvfDjL_TLtRC2s_Q.text: Italian Grotto is a cute little Italian American restaurant. The patio is killer, and although it was a quiet night I can see that it would be an amazing people watching spot in tourist season. The service was attentive, friendly, and helpful with suggestions when my dining companions and I needed them (which we definitely did as there were so many tasty looking options!)   We ordered the Fried Zucchini Del Grotto to share, and I ordered a glass of Sauvignon Blanc. The zucchini wasn't bad, it was crispy and quite flavourful, and the dipping sauce was good but tasted like a re-purposed garlicky pasta sauce; once I adjusted to that I enjoyed the combination of flavours. The wine was ok - I wanted something American at least (I always try to have the most local wine I can get!), and was recommended the sauv; it was fine, easy drinking but not quite such depth of flavour as I was hoping for.  For my main I had the baked ravioli with pomodoro sauce; I was expecting something in a bowl, oozing tomato, covered in cheese and bubbled up in ooey-gooey happiness. My ravioli was on a large plate, which made it seem kind of small initially - but don't worry, it was incredibly filling! The ravioli was filled with a ricotta which contrasted really nicely with the melted cheese on top. The tomato sauce, however was way too rich for the dish - I was hoping for something fresh to stand out beside the greasy, delicious cheese, and instead it was too intense and I left half of it on my plate.  Having an Italian stepdad has made me fussier about Italian food than I'd like, but I'm trying! I liked Italian Grotto, but I'd still take a plate of homemade pasta over restaurant Italian food any day!

photos.caption: Photo of Italian Grotto - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The baked cheese ravioli came in a different format than expected but was tasty in a rich tomato sauce.

276DAk_HqKtZTYDiSUpkrQ.text: BEWARE:  We had the misfortune to patronize this loud, over rated restaurant,  the minestrone is Chunky and not very tasty the salad was just that, salad.  We ordered the calamari which wasn't too bad, but where was the rest of the order?  The scampi was tough, overcooked, pasta al dente?  The sauce was something, don't know what it was supposed to be.  Not even a small piece of French bread on the table?  We aren't drinkers, so had ginger ales.  Maybe that's the reason we were Rushed out? The waiter never asked us if we needed anything else, if the meal was good, etc. just threw the totaled bill on the table in passing,  the Rude owner/maitre d passed our table and we said we'd like the dessert menu.  He said our bill was already totaled, to pay it because he needed our table for  people in line. NEVER, NEVER, have we Ever been asked to leave our table, much less to accommodate other diners.  This person is the rudest excuse for an owner/patron of a business we've ever encountered.  We live in the S.F. Peninsula area where we have many upscale restaurants.  We also know our Italian dishes.  These lack any inspiration.  The chef just wants to serve as quickly as possible, didn't even detect any herbs.  Guess they depend on us using salt and pepper for some flavor, You know, if the service and ambiance is great, most of us won't complain about the food.  But, this place misses the boat in every way. Save your money.    $77.+ for 2 pasta dished, 2 ginger ales and a Small order of calamari.  And, Oh yes, plan to be tossed out if there's a line waiting to eat!   Never again!!!

4Bso5ETrSRwKr7usyaw4zg.text: One of the rudest reception from a host ever received. Would never recommend. If I could give zero stars,I would.
