0RR6IDYhJ0yGlgnRWiwOpA.text: Absolutely the worst Italian Restaurant I've been to, period. The service was cold and uninterested and the food had NO redeeming qualities. My wife ordered pasta with meat balls and I ordered the linguine with white clam sauce. They brought my wife pasta marinara with sauce that was more like thin soup than sauce...when we pointed out the mistake, the waiter argued with us until he remembered that we had asked that the meatballs be very well done...he was pissy from then on...totally unprofessional. When we got the meatballs, they were no where near well done...this led to another round of denial. My linguine was just awful.  It was so salty and fishy that after a few bites, I started feeling sick. Neither of us came close to finishing...we sat there until the bill was finally dropped off...paid and left. The only saving grace were the side salads that were decent. With so many choices in Scottsdale this would be an extremely bad choice...don't go here.

mIWzS_wmGubw6mCaSbVnMQ.text: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE! I wish negative stars were an option. The owner and wait staff are the worst I've ever experienced! I'm a chef and a former restaurant manager and I never have been treated with such disrespect! We were here less than 10 minutes and will never return! I was appalled by the waiter's rudeness and was shocked to see the owner follow suit and fall in line essentially kick us out of the restaurant while swearing at us. I will NEVER go back here and I will encourage anyone and everyone to not go here!

8m-icoxzZWzBU5ao1LfFJw.text: My wife and I stopped for a late afternoon drink and snacks (3:30pm).    The outdoor seating area had one other couple and no one waiting...in fact the place was pretty empty inside and out. When asked if we could sit outside the waiter rudely replied: "Only if you eat"  We said we would have some drinks and appetizers.   When he came back, after we seated ourselves, I asked for a drink menu. Again, with the rude response: "We have 175 drinks...", and then he walked away.   After after a moment, we decided to spend out time, and our money, at an establishment that appreciates customers a bit more.

VfIagh4wFV8w3WvUD8ZLEQ.text: Visited this place this afternoon, food was OK but utensils was dirty, napkins where they serve bread was dirty. Don't want to touch salt and paper at all. Next time for sure will skip this restaurant. Service was not good, people from other tables looking for forks from other empty tables.

imMxhjXGugQoz1LbI0l8gA.text: Italian Grotto is without a doubt my favorite restaurant. I've shared my love with so many of my friends. There is indoor and outdoor seating. The atmosphere is amazing because it's a sports bar and italian restaurant. It's fancy but not too fancy. The service is always incredible and the food is delicious. If you love pasta this is definitely the place to go.

419ckijmEVy6TfZtpHamVg.text: Terrible customer service. If I could rate this place a zero, I absolutely would. My family and I (party of 6) arrived and right away noticed very few customers. We were coming for Italian desserts and drinks. No drink menu was given and we were told right away that they were out of all desserts and we were in the wrong place. An old man that seemed drunk (but worked at the restaurant) did not leave us alone and urged us to order "dinner" food right away or just get out.  Do not go to this place, period. Spend your money elsewhere...

DdjLdonvTeCrwQechILhNQ.text: Do not step through the door!  I showed up to dine alone on a bustling Friday night. I stated I was here to dine alone and the grease ball maitre d replied, "not tonight." I said excuse me? He replied again, "not tonight!" I explained that I wanted to be seated for dinner and asked if I could sit at the bar, without looking he said, "there are no bar stools available and I'm being nice." If that is his version of "being nice," then I think my money is best spent where I can receive good service.  Do not patronize this establishment!

2vd8RSju2_xLAytCYNVKhA.text: No star if I could! DO NOT GO HERE!   These people are absolutely horrible and toxic! They verbally attacked me my husband my mother and our 2 month old baby for wanting to order.   We were unsure about the place from the start and only my husband was hungry so he ordered the most simple thing on the menu, spaghetti and meatballs. While we waited for his food we decided why not bring a dish home to my mothers husband. Apparently that's not okay at this establishment. After a very awkward encounter with our server repetitively not answering us about ordering food and forcefully saying here is your check...  A middle aged women came to the table and started throwing a fit, yelling and cursing clearly under the influence. She almost leaped across the table to physically attack me until the only kind young man that worked there grabbed her. She called me a bad mother and a lot of curse words screaming so loud the entire restaurant was staring. They threatened to call the cops? Instead I did and it seems that the cops are called there a lot. I reported them to the better business bureau of Scottsdale.   I can not believe this place is still in business. HORRIBLE people, food and the place is a dump!!! Restroom is a disgrace. The workers were eating food off bused plates and drinking on the job. We were sat at the furthest booth in the back of the restaurant where you could see all the behind the scenes of this disgraceful place!   Anyone that supports a business owner who hits people and belittles everyone in his establishment has some serious issues!  Step up people, get this place shut down!

zPAGUt4I_VuHMDBNrhR-Ow.text: A good friend of mine is a picky eater and this is her favorite place in Old Town. That being said, I've been twice but haven't been super impressed. The homemade sausage was good but the spaghetti it came with was not very flavorful. It's hard to mess up anything with garlic and cheese on it and I'd say the food is decent but if you know how to boil water and take the lid off a pasta sauce jar, I'd recommend going for that instead. My ravioli experience was similarly underwhelming.  Both times I was here, I would've preferred a higher temperature on the minestrone soup or my pasta. It's possible that the secret to good food here is to order something other than pasta, but it's an Italian restaurant....  Ambiance is classic Italian place meets sports. The outdoor seating is adorable for more of a date vibe.  Service varies- I had one excellent server and one that ignored us basically all night. All in all, a mixed bag.

R3edCf5UsSIGaNs7bvBXYA.text: Ehhhh it was alright, I can't say much I had to come here out of necessity for my grandmothers sake to use a restroom.   Well wile I was here the waiter was kind and attentive all we got was water and some appetizers didn't really care for any food at the time. We got the garlic bread and the fried artichoke. All I can say is ehhhh the bread was ok my ma complained saying it had to much garlic but it was ok. The artichoke however was too sore in my opinion like a release of vinegar with a bite the sauce for the artichoke was not so good too cheesy.   But on that note the service was decent and attentive the place inside reminded me of a scene out of a Bronx tale or something very old school decor and had an old smell like the place had been around for a wile , didn't see many or any customers. The inside had lots of baseball stuff and was kinda cool.   Well in the last note I don't think it would be the first Italian spot I'd go to , so on that note I give it a 2

tsCovQF31Ew3ympVd-wezw.text: This was A great place for dinner. The meals were hot and tasty and the staff was very friendly. I enjoyed the cheesy bread and the service with a smile.

-V4DIPf3gxylDO2MLELeig.text: Place was recommended by a friend so we decided to stop by after the Giants game. When we walked in the manager or owner was eating a bag of chips at the front thankful he put a bag of chips down and sat us. There were four of us we all ordered main meals. I got a side salad with blue cheese which was not very good. My wife got the minestrone soup which she said was great. We ordered a side of garlic bread. The garlic bread was very good. I ordered the manicotti which the noodle was definitely cooked earlier in the day but the cheese stuffing was very fresh. I could tell the shell was cooked earlier because the ends were very tuff. My wife ordered the angel hair Primavera which she loved but also said was watery. The food came out very fast and the service was good. Overall we all enjoyed our food but the speed our food cane to the table and the service made it that much better.

iB_ouNu7nqw16Kh9w_3FbA.text: Amazing halibut   Beck is the best ever  I also had the Tiramisu.   Mmmmm. Great atmosphere. I will come here every time I'm in town

W2tGN-JDRIk8wW0cnqYngA.text: When i was brought the wrong meal and said i didn't order that,  confirmed by the dumb stump bartender,  this fake NY prick said I was cooking to eat it or he'd pour it on my head. I started to eat it anyway and saw him berating his idiot employees,  i paid for my drunk and left.  ......the old guy came outside where i was sitting and said he should smack me for not eating it. I said go for it. He tried. I didn't hit back cuz he's too old and ready to die.  Called the cops instead.  His whole staff said i left without paying and he didn't touch me.  Scottsdale PD must be paid off cuz they didn't do anything. I'm sure he'll be dead or shut down soon from being a prick. Hits like a girl too.  Amazing Arizona.......

photos.caption: Photo of Italian Grotto - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wanna Be.

KqqIF-Wc6u4cnd8mPKqTFg.text: Worst restaurant ever been to in my life! Food was cold and disgusting..Tried to tell the owner but he was rude and obnoxious and was not nice at all. I am so sorry that I usually never complain however this place should be be shut down because of all the filthy tables,,floors and the Bathrooms are totally gross* and crap all over floor!  Where is health Dept . on this issue? We will never patronize this establishment again.!!!!

CDtrH8_Lxu2W2KxFAclKdA.text: I wanted to love this place. It's got a great outdoor dining area. I called and asked if they allowed dogs on the patio as we were traveling with our pup. They did. Pretty sure it was the owner I talked to and he remembered me when we showed up and got us a nice table. He was great.   I'll agree with the reviews that said the Halibut is amazing. My husband got it and it was well cooked. That's the only good part of the meal.   I get it's spring training and Scottsdale is busy, but our waiter was slow AF. I knew before I got there I wanted the Ribeye. I'm a steak girl, husband's an italian and seafood fan. Got the menu, there was a ribeye special listed and ribeye was a regular part of the menu. This was at 6PM I should add.   We saw a white lasagna that looked good, so we ordered it as an appetizer. I knew right then what kind of Italian resturant it was. It was covered in cream sauce and melted cheese, I mean... swimming in it. The flavor was so so, but there was enough cream sauce to take a bath.   Bread came next only after asking 3 times. There was a good 15 minute wait between the lasagna and the bread. Then our waiter took our order. I go to order the ribeye he says they think they are out of the ribeye. We ask if the other steak dish on the menu is with something other than ribeye. Nope. He takes my order and says he'll check but they were down to their last one. OK. I look for my backup.   I think we're safe as we don't see our waiter for another 10 minutes or so. When he returns he says no go on the ribeye and asks for my backup. I order the Chicken Colorado which is chicken sauteed with prosciutto and mushrooms. He says it's great.  At some point our waiter, I should add, the only waiter we saw on the patio all night drops a fried mozzarella dish on the table. It looks delicious, we both think maybe this is his "sorry we're out of Ribeye" plate. As he walks by like 4 minutes later, we tell him we didn't order it. He says weird, the kitchen told me you did. Um, how would the kitchen know, and you don't? Then he takes it off our table and he puts it on the right table... didn't ask if we'd touched it, etc.   All of the staff other than the owner appeared to be bored or maybe slightly high disinterested young men. Timeliness was not a priority. Apparently neither was accuracy.   Our dinners arrive. As I say, Hubbies Halibut was delicious. My Chicken Colorado is terrible it's literally rubber chicken drowning in a butter based sauce that I can't even dry off enough to get to my mouth. It's like in a soup with maybe a dozen pasta noodles under the rubber chicken.   Everything was drowning in italian parsley that tasted like it was dried and stale 6 months ago and everything was lacking flavor, but soaked in butter, cream or cheese. Old people Italian.   The location, the people watchiing, the owners, the halibut reasons to go there. Everything else, definitely reasons to stay away.

Ivv68VXLKgt754UYc9UPgw.text: I'm happy that I didn't bother to research this gem on Yelp before trying it. I'm shocked by the rating here.  I found everything from the food, most of the staff, to the ambience to my liking. I felt as if I were in an old school New York Italian restaurant.  The menu overwhelmed me initially.  Because I love Italian fare, it was difficult to make a selection. After the hotess described the house specials, I decided immediately.  I settled on a delicious scallops dish. The pasta and scallops were both cooked perfectly. I was beyond pleased.  The ambience: dim lightning with candles at each table, the warm interaction between the staff and diners, Frank Sinatra and Billie Holiday serving as the backdrop. Such fun!  Meatball, our waiter was very accomodating and a True gentleman.  My only issue: I would like to go back and sit at what seemed to be an ambly stocked bar; but the bartender was so loud and obnoxious that I wouldn't dare. In fact, when I return, I will ask for a table furthest from the bar in order not to hear him at all.

b4SogXnv8W77lb2A5-zy6A.text: Food and service was horrible. Highly not recommended.    Server forgot we ordered drinks, brought out one salad, other server repeatedly tried to give us food from other tables, calmari in cioppino was spoiled, bread tasted stale, sangio wine was warm, well above room temp, water pooled in bottom of my bolognese . Caprese salad was okay, nothing special.  just not a great choice.

QSrpjkSo8mD5WQpJEETAcA.text: I had high expectations when I arrived. My body was craving home made spaghetti and meatballs.   It started off ok. The wine I chose was not a good example Montepulciano. I then proceeded to ask if I could get soda water instead of regular water. We will talk about that later.   It was weird as it is an Italian restaurant and the were playing 80's throw back music. During my entire meal the waiter and bartender sat right behind me and I had to take in their whole conversation. Not cool. We always kept our conversations in the kitchen.  The rest of my meal was ok and the meatballs were good. I was waiting to close out and get my check. The bill came and I said there must be an error, my wine was only $9 and this says $12. No, it is right said the waiter. Your soda water was $3.00.   I said you kidding Right? He said no it is $3. I said, you are charging me $3 For a .02 cent pour from the bar gun? Yes.   I won't be back. Someone is trying to pay their mortgage or pay for their kids school on my dime. It is such a rip off when people do that. I've been in this business a long time and that winds me up. If it were bottled sparkling, yes. It is sad because I finally tried this place out and had high anticipation.  #Rebelfoodandwine #vino2 #Vinosquared #Vino2ultimate #irishcatv2 #italiangrotto

WH2CQIACcgDIgG4H2Iqv6A.text: I heard this septic tank sludge excuse for a restaurant closes next Sunday 5/26.  I hope that is True and the greater Scottsdale area can be put out out of its misery.  Mediocre food served with a side of pretentious buffoonery served fresh daily by the noxious owner.  Ciao!

65CyNPptE2DVCi-yDAwlKA.text: I gotta say, the owner rocks!  Cross between Keith Richards and some Bronx  Mafia boss.  He presents and uncaring and aggressive  but pay attention.  It's an act and if you play along he's gonna give you all you need and then some.  Come for the show, stay for the halibut.  Best cooked halibut I've ever had.  Also worth noting, biggest and best martinis you'll find.    Thanks Gary!  I wish this was my neighborhood Italian joint back in Oakland, CA.  I'll be back whenever I'm in town!

Q-95Xaz8oBZU1EEe0Gpihw.text: Walked in around 1:00 on a Saturday and got a table right away. Service was good and food was better. Ordered the calamari as an app and the garlic bread (which was super good ). Place is decorated really cool with all signed sports memorabilia. We had a group of 4 and ordered and eggplant Parm, veal parm, fettuccine chicken Alfredo, and chicken piccata all of which were good. I would recommend for sure !

dsmO6QXVCgK0BBQvs8wbtw.text: The prices were okay.. the waitor was okay.. the food was okay.. nothing to brag about.. the lighting is very dim and im a person that like to be able to see my food throughly.  So i just paid for my food. And this place does not offer receipts? I need actual receipts and they are hand writing on a paper. This is unacceptable in 2018..  get your shit together.  The waiter then goes and tries to blame me. That i should have told him when i sat down! Who the hell knows a place does not have a receipts.   He then tells me that "my boss trust him thats why its no big deal about receipts." it has nothing to do with him but about a client expensing food and keeping receipts for tax purposes and record keeping.

Ij-47qm8-2-bQqjzYAZbWQ.text: The worst customer service Ive ever encountered. I assume it was the owner as he implied. Not only was he hateful he was unsanitary and dirty. I watched him run his hands over his hair then cup the top of our water glasses and carry them to our table. he sits them down wipes his sweaty brow with his hand wipes his hair with his hands and grabs two more waters for another table with his hands on top of the glass again.   This man was so rude and hateful to my daughter and she is the most loving person who doesn't get offended easy and she was offended.    we decided to leave based on how he was treating us and walked across the street to buca de peppa and had a wonderful experience. the food was good and everyone from the hostess to the kitchen staff (because they walk you thru the kit h) was fabulous. we had a great meal and good conversations. As we walked back past grotto this man was cleaning tables and throwing the liquid from glasses on the side walk. He gave us a hateful look as we walked by, my daughter was afraid he was going to hit me.

FB-2l-DhR7gJIRcTAKf73A.text: Great spot.  Great Italian food.  It's always crowded (except in the heat of summer) worth the wait and always good.   The eggplant Parmesan with a mushroom sauce is exquisite.  Everything we have tried on the menu is great.  It's a highlight to a trip to the Phoenix area.

pQI18uZqrme0hhZo_SS4ZQ.text: I stopped going here a while ago due to low quality seafood, but went today, because I remember really enjoying the tiramisu...however, today it was tiny and very average tasting, not to mention over priced.  Also, let me add, that 5 bucks for a small glass of Pabst is insane.  We should have gone across the street to buca di bepo.

MZZsT_eKWbUGPZ0Vv-V7IQ.text: The owner was our server. The low class food was very over-rated as well as the prices. Owner was absolutely rude to our party of 4. He made snide comments regarding our questions and I believe they over-charged us. They add gratuity to the check so they don't need to provide good service. I would rather eat at mcdonalds than this place. Save your money and skip this hole in the wall. It was my worst experience at a restaurant because of the callous and rude waiter/owner. The other people in my party agree that the restaurant was terrible. I will tell everyone I know to avoid this place when they come to Scottsdale. Mat from las Vegas.

q37N_pn6YZQvfpRiaGN39g.text: If you want good (even great) food and GOOD service, just walk down the street a block or so to Bandera

KMYtgI6sNnlATJme_7qIoA.text: Ambience was amazing.  The dining room smelled fantastic.  Service was perfect (prompt and formal, yet unpretencious). We had Halibut with lemon/butter/caper sauce and Scallops over linguine.  Everything was fresh and delicious.  We were also very happy with the wine. It was a Malbec, only around $30 for the bottle, and it was great.

1UTAfrOcJ_-gKefP1_1VvA.text: Wow!  From the moment I heard the Sinatra music on the sidewalk to the last smell of marinara sauce in the air as I left the building, this place exceeded any expectation.  This place smelled, breathed, sounded and tasted of something you would expect in 70's Chicago or New York.  My buddy and I were in town for Spring Training and both agreed that this was the best spot to which we had been in 10 or so years making the annual trip.  He is a martini drinker and was blown away by the taste and abundance.  I had two glassed of fantastic Pinot.  We split a plate of manicotti as an appetizer (based on the recommendation of a long-time customer that was sitting at the bar while we were waiting for a table) and then each had the veal parmesan (outstanding).  I just wish I had saved some room for dessert.

cuiemLQ3eMA7TcsJjloD0g.text: Never again will I go back. The service is outrageously bad. "meatball" ...thats right he actually says to call him that...to EVERY table. Was downright rude and the ego was radiating! I think he thought he was in the move "good fellas" or something? Second time here and we still feel the same way. We thought the first time we would give it another shot but never again! The manicotti was not even good..it was chewy and the mozzerella on top was burnt. Not to mention the sauce was just stewed tomatos out of a can. NEVER will we return.

SIcrKJmE-m6aNsvsqbqyWg.text: I had a really nice time at the Italian Grotto.    The atmosphere is very "New York Italian".  There are comfy leather booths and tv's above the bar playing sports.  It is a great place to sit for a while and have some fun at dinner and watch the game at the same time.   The staff is very cool, most of the time friendly, and the manager could be from the mafia.  The food is typical Italian food, nothing to "odd". I like being a bit more adventurous with food most of the time.... but it is was really good. We had the fresh Clams and Muscles in the Portifino sauce.....and I had the Chicken Piccata (yum) and my friend had the Veal Marsala (also very good).

LoygjHRXu987SXLAgjF75w.text: We have been there twice now and loved it both times.  They don't make you feel terribly welcome. Getting seated both times was a little awkward.  The waiters both times were really good (attentive) but a little standoffish.  The food has been excellent though.  I took the waiter's recommendation of the veal carolina and it was super!  We will definitely go back and even will look forward a little to the pseudo feeling of being an intruder.  Oddly, combined with how good the food is, it is quite charming.

bvwbCeruqX45kZvywp3KuQ.text: When I walked into this place I felt like I was walking into a restaurant from Baltimore's Little Italy. The service was to the point but personal... Wine list was limited but selective, and the menu was excellent. Great bread, nice fresh seafood.

sKXsEBZvtTUwAnJnCLvpIA.text: DO NOT GO HERE....unless you enjoy spending 200 dollars in under an hour and geting told to leave by  the crack head alcoholic owner. After spending less than an hour and still with wine in our glasses - he walked up and  pulled the table back away from us and said to leave because he had a "wait". I had been there several times and used to reccomend this place but NO way now. I told him that I would no longer support his restaurant with horrible service like that and his response was (in front of my guests and other tables around):  "You think I care? Look at my wait, get the hell out. Go get laid and quit busting my balls."  I hope people don't support service like that because there are a ton of other restaurants in Scottsdale with better service and better food.....

EvlljM7yWGN4KXqKLIg1mw.text: My friend & I were in town for a couple nights so we decided to check out Scottsdale.  We were walking around looking for someplace to have dinner and came across Italian Grotto.  I read previous reviews & wasn't too sure how great our experience would be here, but decided to give this restaurant a try.  The staff here were awesome!  We got seated right away & service was top notch!  We immediately got served & all our drinks & food came out in a very timely manner.   We started out with a bottle of malbec wine for only $34, which we really enjoyed. Our waiter, Terrance was the excellent!  He recommended one of the specials which was a seafood medley of fish, calamari, shrimp, clams, mussels, & scallops in a cream sauce over linguine pasta.  I also had their soup of the day, homemade minestrone, which came with my meal.  Both were very good!  My friend had the clam rapallo: clams simmered in seafood stock, fresh garlic, herbs and white wine served over pasta. She had their house salad that also came with her meal.  She really enjoyed her meal as well.  The food was great, portion sizes generous, reasonable prices, nice ambience, friendly  & prompt service from all the staff!!! 3.5-4 stars on food quality, 5 stars for making our dining experience in Scottsdale memorable & great!
