5cbjUvGDmx_1eK07IypxEQ.text: Lunch here was great. Ordered steamer clams with garlic bread. Owner comes by and says I need some rigatoni for my sauce. Grabs my bowl and goes and gets it. We shot the sh--t a little. Really good dude. Old school place and old school music playing. Love it

oPbx8qRkpZs4nnuNvsAfRQ.text: Should have read the review before coming.    I was in Scottdale for business, and the local hotel recommended Italian Grotto for dinner.  We called ahead to see if we can make a reservation, they told us there aren't any reservations available, but the walk-in wait time is only 10 minutes.  Upon arriving (5 minute drive), the front desk person told us it would be at least a 30 minutes wait.  Fine, maybe a few large parties decided to show up between the time we called and when we arrived.  After 30 minutes, we were finally seated.  After being seated, we waited another 15 minutes for a waiter to stop by with water.  It took another 10 minutes for him to come back with the water and the menu for us to order.  By then, we have waited for a good 30 minutes before putting in our orders.    We ordered fried calamari and zucchini, spaghetti w/ meatballs, sausage and peppers, and the shrimp scampi.  The waiter somehow messed up our order where our entree came out first without any appetizers.  After 10 minutes, we asked about the waiter to cancel the appetizers as we were already finishing our entrees.  The waiter said he would check, but came back with our appetizers 10 minutes afterwards.  To summarize our experience:  Good: 1. Great location, in the heart of old town  Bad: 1. Poor management - misjudged/misspoke wait-time just to get more business 2. Slow Waiters - it takes him at least 10 minutes to come back to our tables.  Took over 30 minutes to put in order despite us asking to order 3. Bad waiter attitude - even after making the mistake of not putting in our appetizer, the waiter would not own up and cancel our order.  Came back 10 minutes afterwards with our appetizers when we already finished our entrees 4. Mediocre food - everything was extra salty  Overall, would not recommend anyone coming here.  So many other places to go with better service and food.

UE_hbDcN2fz5COARQKPtlQ.text: We had a mediocre dinner tonight. I have been here before but after tonight, we won't be returning. The salad was just OK. Lettuce with a ton of blue cheese dressing that tasted like sour cream. The entree of halibut was good. The waiter apparently didn't like the tip our host gave him. He came back and asked if the service was OK. Then whispered something rude in our host's ear. As we were exiting the table made a big deal of saying "You can't believe this table" to one of his coworkers. Then followed my 84 year old Mom and I and told us he only got a 10% tip. Tips are DISCRETIONARY for one thing and we had no control over that. Classless! If you want real Italian food served by polite people in a relaxed atmosphere, go to Tommy V's and forget this place.

CyDMBtjXbIFW5_0DxcpRSQ.text: No stars... One word: TERRIBLE!  Not clean. Food bad.  Chicken piccata had strange bad taste.  Fresh mozzarella was dry. Minestrone soup was ok.

7DONqogPJc7cBs3fyI4qVg.text: Ok, so we came in after seeing how cute the spot looked, great location,  etc.  We asked the owner where to check in to be seated.  He rudely told us to just stand there and he'd get us seated.  Eventually a very kind waiter seated us.  The waiter was sweet, his name was Tony.  I had an enjoyable appetizer (calamari) and salad. Then my entree came (chicken parm). I won't lie,  my food was all tasty.  However,  as I  (luckily) almost completed my meal, my cheek was stabbed and I pulled a staple out  of my cheek.  Not a little staple that you use in the house, but more like a staple you'd see in a carpet or similar.  A thick, sharp staple.  I told my waiter.  He was shocked and brought it to the owner.  Immediately I had the owner say "fuck her I'll buy her a cocktail".  He came outside to the table and with an immediate nastiness asked if I own a kitchen or have ever washed a dish.  He said it was clearly from a steel sponge. Now I do in fact own a kitchen,  and I cook and clean for my family daily.  When I clean a dish, I not only wash, but also rinse them.  I have never had to pull a piece of steel from someone's mouth.  But believe me, this was no piece of sponge.. but a STAPLE.  The waiter continued to apologize.  I said I understood but after his response and lack of concern (owner) I would gladly pay our bill, minus the entree that the staple was in.  Oh, the owner also nastily  asked if I was injured, as if to imply I was being dramatic by bringing it to my servers attention.   When I said "well I did take it from my cheek" he yelled "so is there a hole in there?".  I mean.. Nasty. Anyways, the waiter went to presumably tell the owner I was surprised at how he handled it and he immediately started screaming, cursing at the waiter, etc.  He ran out, yelling at me telling me he would take $10 off (whooptie  doo) and I had 2 minutes to pay or the cops were being called.  After the bill was paid, I heard him inside saying how he has 5 daughters so he is used to bitches... mind you, I was very respectful as hard as it was and maintained composure and a respectful tone throughout.   On my way out I kindly said that I pray his daughters wind up with men more respectful than him and I told him he was a disrespectful disgrace.  He continually yelled for me to get away from him, as if I was a bother. And literally closed the doors in my face.  It was so insanely rude, it was comical.  It actually made for a great night and hilarious story, but the man clearly isn't right in the head.  He seems to be a very sad, pathetic, insecure man.  And he is lucky my sister and I dined without our husbands as he would have been laid out on the street for talking to a woman like he did had they been there.

z7u1cQ-UTF0LWA_iAdw46g.text: If I could give this place -0 stars, I would! My wife and I came to Scottsdale to meet friends in Old Town for dinner. While waiting for my friends to arrive, we walked the neighborhood. My wife went in to this cute place to check the menu and use the restroom. She came out and suggested that I do the same. Just after entering the men's room, the owner banged loudly on the door and demanded for me to leave - immediately! I own businesses and travelled the world and have never been treated so rudely. I was, and still am in shock! I sincerely recommend you avoid this place.

YabOzb3nFx3H2RxKj3M4JQ.text: My first time in Old Scottsdale and the first restaurant I tried. My in-laws are first generation Itslian and the food here is the real deal. The Chilean Sea Bass with ravioli was perfect!  The fried zucchini was great. The True test came when I ordered the cannoli. It was truly Italian and huge - easily enough for 2. There regulars eating at the bar - was a cozy, fun environment. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Italian Grotto - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Authentic cannoli big enough for 2!

1TeJAJqrByZqam-ql81u4A.text: The owner was the rudest man I have ever encountered.  I have been in the restaurant business my whole life and have never been treated so bad in my life.  He actually told me and my friends to get the F--- out of his restaurant.  He said we couldn't eat in his restaurant.  All we did was walk in.  He used the F word 3 times. I was embarrassed and shocked.  I really hope karma bites his in the ass.

hFsHjYLkdP7cMr2b-If-Mw.text: FOOD POISONiNG ALERT ! We had dinners at this restaurant and my whole family had poisoning. The food is not good here and the service is very poor !!  The owner is an ugly guy (inside out) with major attitude,  DON"T WASTE MY MONEY AND HEALTH HERE !!!

qUY6NWyT5i7dEd9NVaRvcg.text: My food came out one degree above room temperature. Not worth the money. Fried artichokes were alright but pricy for what it is.

photos.caption: Photo of Italian Grotto - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cold spinach ravioli

KtsRzePkKFO5sip3X7rRrw.text: The four of us went there on a Friday night and were treated like gold. Harvey our server was amazing and really made the experience enjoyable with his banter and personality.   The food was delicious. Each of us liked our dish so much that we shared with each other and argued over which was the best... we never decided on which one won. Because we were discussing how much we all like minestrone soup, Harvey bought a bowl for the table so we could try it. It was delicious food and such genuinely good service.   I highly recommend this place if you're looking for an Itilain restaurant in downtown Scottsdale. It's kitchy and has a feel that's not too fancy, but the food and service feel as if you were in the most upscale of places. Fantastic.

U6harOqc_DRTvPYDM167qg.text: I've been coming here for the last five years during spring training and have always been so happy with my meals. Everything I've tried had been delicious. The staff is really great, they all seem like a big happy Italian family. The food portions are are generous and and they don't skimp on the garlic! Love it :)

photos.caption: Photo of Italian Grotto - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Both Alfredo dishes one with veggies. Plus a tasty cocktail.
Photo of Italian Grotto - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fetticini Alfredo. So so yummy!

q70s7PDIVpGDbEzbm7q65w.text: As a small female, I was assaulted and slandered at this rough and tumble, unsanitary bar by an employee and the owner.   I was so excited to eat at the Italian Grotto in Scottsdale with my husband. He had talked about the ambiance and the great food when he ate here the previous year when I couldn't attend with him. Well, we finally made it there (I'm from Ohio) on March 22 on a very busy night, to be fair. I was facing the bar and watched the owner pick up two dirty water glasses and a used napkin from a bus tray and wipe the rims of the glasses, refill them with more ice and water, and serve them to another table. As I watched, my husband kept saying, 'What are you looking at?' I said 'I will tell you outside.' The owner saw that I had seen him, and came up to our table and asked about our meals, as a way to change the subject. I said nothing about what I had seen.  The next day I was out shopping around 2 p.m. and went in to use the restroom, wrongly assuming that since I had eaten dinner there the night before it would be OK. As I stood in the middle of the dark room, a huge bouncer barreled his chest into my backside and  asked what I was doing there. I said I wanted to use the restroom because I had eaten there the day before. He said, "Where did you sit?" I pointed to our table and he said, "That's a lie. I was here and I don't remember you. You are a liar!"  At that point, the owner approached the altercation and asked what was going on. As I tried to explain, he talked over me and said, "There is a reason we don't allow people from the street to use our restroom." I told him I had eaten there the night before, and he and the bouncer nudged me toward the exit. Together, one on each side of me, they yelled to the passersby on the sidewalk, pointing their fingers at me, "This lady is a liar. She is liar! We don't allow liars in our restaurant!"  I went back to the hotel and told my husband the story, in tears. I am a professional women, well-dressed, in my 50s and have never been treated like this at an establishment. I question the tone of the place. Is this the way everyone acts in Scottsdale because it is a baseball town? Obviously, I will never go back to the restaurant and I am re-thinking whether Scottsdale is the place for me to spend my money.

5LwhVqWH42nl-u9mWKg9bg.text: Warm greeting, nice outside tables & service was OK, but food was mediocre and overpriced.  The eggplant parmigiana was excellent, but the veal marsala was overcooked & then over-seasoned in a vain attempt to hide that.  Seems like focus here is on tourist crowd and numbers rather than earning repeat customers.

uzzCc74sWv-Vq7AY6lG1YA.text: This is my family's favorite spot to eat when vacationing in Arizona. The food is absolutely spectacular. The ravioli, lasagna, and seafood fettuccine are a few of my favorite dishes. Although it is expensive, the experience and the food are definitely worth it!

cLvy3bg1-BVhqiOXqGC0GA.text: This place is an absolute joke. Upon 2 minutes of being at the establishment, simply asking if the Golden State Warriors game was being played, the owner of the restaurant told me and my younger brother to shut up multiple times and threatened to fight my father and spit in my mothers eye. The bouncer blamed it on the owner being in a "cranky" mood. Cranky or not; telling minors to shut up and threatening to fight your customers is completely unacceptable. And on top of it, according to a couple locals after the exchange; it is shitty and overpriced Italian food. If you want to pay a lot for bad food and to be harassed then this is your place! Legitimately the single worst restaurant experience I have had in my entire life. Found this article from SIXTEEN YEARS AGO that relatively matches our experience: phoenixnewtimes.com/rest... legitimately cannot believe this place is still in business.

tyotDHftgBgfEJIprJP1yg.text: We heard that Scottsdale the place to find good eats in the area. Most of the non-chain restaurants are located around here and if I had more time, I TOTALLY would have wanted to explore Old Town more!!  Italian Grotto is a cute restaurant with waiters that don't really smile except when you're on your way out the door.  There was no wait here on a Wednesday night around 7:30!!   Here is what I ordered: 1. Calarmari - It was okay. More fried batter than there was squid, but the pieces that DID have squid were good. THe batter is not too heavy and is fluffy like tempura batter..no that was decent.  2. Garlic Bread - for 2 slices for bread drenched in garlic butter, $8 was a hefty price for what it was. too buttery and not enough bread!  3. Eggplant/Mushroom Parm - This dish was a disaster. It came out with a side of spaghetti and the eggplant mushroom part of the entree was wrapped up in a shitload of cheese. It was, for all intents and purposes, a cheese pocket with ridiculously thin slices of eggplant and 7 pieces of mushroom shoved into it. It wasn't even good cheese..it was cheap cheese that was cold when it reached the table and similar to pizza cheese that had been refridgerated overnight. Blech.  4.Tiramisu - This is the only reason I would ever return to this restaurant..it was AWESOME! I like the tiramisu where it is like biting into a sweet coffee cloud. I would come here and order 5 slices of tiramisu next time because this was the only part of the meal that impressed me..  2 stars for the tiramisu..hip hip hooray!!

wuA0r5tJaDS-14-E3xfISA.text: The place was empty when I entered. The staff was accommodating and delightful! The ambience was great. Entrees was reasonably priced. Speaking of the food.... I ordered the Chicken Marsala which came with a salad. The salad was very hearty! Although the dressing was sold as Italian; it was more like balsamic. I like balsamic so I won't go further with that complaint... The chicken Marsala was not so good. What happened to sauteing the mushrooms? They were still raw. As if the chef had hoped the steam from the over-cooked chicken would do the job!  Not very impressive... Maybe I'll go back when I'm not so sober.

roDEDiAlzkZWNYE3JE-ujw.text: Incredible food. Terrible service!!!!  Thanks Meatball. Tell Dan Patrick we said Duh Huh!!!

DL5uskH2nSqxmCK2dRyfDw.text: Customer service was not so good. I had questions about the menu to which the server did not answer due to laziness. He was rude and it nearly ruined my dining experience. I ordered something I've never tried before and didn't like it but didn't bother to speak up because I felt my server would not have done anything to help considering he was already tired and seemed bothered. Place is nice though. I might go back...

G3p0oHzFPQjSMn9e8FRIkg.text: Wow am I disappointed.   We've been coming here for years but this time we were treated like they never want to see us again.  So that may be the result.   I don't care if everyone in your party hasn't arrived. You should still be seated with a reservation before walk ins. Instead we were told they no longer had a table inside for us so we had to desk with traffic and car fumes through our meal.  And I was told I was complaining and what a bad day they were having. Well my day didn't get bad until my arrival at Italian Grotto.   This has been a must stop for years but no longer.

JTX4RA0XOMYTutPBgGYilQ.text: Very disappointed! and a waste of $400  I have visited your restaurant on two previous occasions and I was pleased with your food and overall experience.  It's been a year since my last visit and you have changed for the worse.  We brought visitors from out of state and today's dinner was an embarrassment to my husband and I. The quality of the food was very poor,  below average standards.  Plain Cesar Salad (soggy , wet lettuce, with mostly anchovy flavor), plain butter pasta (loaded with garlic when specifically requested simple), cold soup, shoe bottom Veal Piccata drenched in a whole bottle of capers on a bed of soupy olive oil stepped on vegetables, salty, a side dish of vegetables was a mushed up serving of again the same stepped on vegetables, the Tiramisu was overwhelmed by a thick cream that did not taste like mascarpone at all.  The cook , chef needs some direction.

hK50ev2Mna7QURHVjSjRAQ.text: This place was a perfect place to end our stay in Scottsdale.   Preface: On NYE we were looking for a place to eat. This place was booked. The owner suggested a place that he thought would be good for our party. We went there and it was.   We (6) went for a nice dinner. We were seated quickly and service was immediate. The server suggested wines and appetizers .  The calamari was cooked perfectly with a spicy marinara sauce. The fried artichoke again perfect with an Alfredo sauce. Because of the size of our party he made each 1 1/2 the size.  We had 5 different meals so we could sample each other's food. He split one chicken dish for $5 and each got their own salad. Each was prepared to our liking - fish, 2 chicken, 1 shrimp , 1 Ravioli (this could have been bigger).  Too full for desert we ordered one to split. This turned into 3 to share (for no extra cost)        We asked for the owner to thank him for the recommendation and a great experience here. We had a great conversation. He ended up sending over his special cordial for us.   Highly recommend this place.

0pYQwfpd9GrBm3TCwwad5A.text: My family and I decided to walk around old town and stopped for a bite to eat. The food was okay, but the service was horrible. Our server was completely disrespectful and didn't seem to care about our table at all. We asked him to put on the ASU v UA game, and his tone bye took with us was something I hope my 14 year is sister will never hear again in the service industry. Don't go here.

SIRgf1YBxofJe0kLmiRa9w.text: This manager from the start was very rude eating his food before getting my order. He didn't mind to wash his hands I'm sure which is a health code as well. My pregnant wife also happened to go to the bathroom which was not clean causing her to vomit. I would not recommend this place at all.

J2iFzDr-KwyuAIuL9vo0Ow.text: This is a little gem in Old Scottsdale. They do have gluten free selections for those of you that can't eat wheat/gluten. I enjoy having a wonderful fresh salad, gluten free pasta and a glass of ice tea for lunch out on the patio to people watch during the day!

UYNvF-TU-NOw1UfaLqTg8A.text: Lunch prices were very high and he portions were small. What appeared to be the owner was very rude and made us very uncomfortable. If it had not been for the fact that we already ordered food, we would have left. I would never recommend this place for anyone.

k7cJ3XZ7HlFzCwWye51xvw.text: Absolutely amazing food and service. Great ambiance!! Would highly recommend. The owner greeted us outside when we got there. Best service ever and the greatest Italian food I've ever had!! Must try!!

UUJ9XL7fFYZg_c0KaoAEYQ.text: Unlike the other negative reviews, I liked the owner, the server was great, the ambiance was wonderful and the food was fantastic.  The Halibut Piccata, while delicious, was a little pricey at $30 for a lunchtime entree in the middle of the old west so i took off one star.

BTZnXiSkP-6tP27jp3oZdA.text: Let me start by saying that the food was excellent!  Not the service.  The watress had a verbal fight with the owner and went to the back and didn't come out for about 15 minutes.   Owner said they were short staffed.  Our waiter (he called himself meatball) was awful!  While we were waiting for our check (a very long time) the people next to us caught him and asked for our check.  He said he walked by us 15 times in 15 minutes.  Lie.  When the other table mentioned that they needed help, he said he needed better customers and that we are only dollar signs.  Stay away.

cz_j7wKbLLy6inCIkLkupw.text: I got turned away at the door because my whole party wasn't with me... at 3 PM when the restaurant was half empty. Then our server was wearing a hat and sunglasses inside, seemed pretty baked, was hard to understand, and just kind of underperformed based on Old Town standards. The food was marginal at best, but it was pretty bland. Scottsdale prices for food Olive Garden could easily beat. Just bad.

1U4yB0hOgMyDPX5bTQ9A6w.text: I didn't dislike the place but I didn't like it that much either. My wife and I ate there on an 'off day' during the week.  Yeah...we got seated fast...yeah...the service was good.  Lots of personality in this place.  Very east coast feelings in most ways. The decor was OK. Probably not what I would expect for a place that is somewhat pricy.  I got a glass of red wine. A very very modest size glass I would add.  I doubt a 4 oz pour. My  wife got a basic cocktail.  All was OK really.  Bread came out and it was white bread and butter. Ok....how can you mess that up. We got a zucchini appetizer. Again...not bad, but not thrilling. Was served with an Alfredo sauce, which I thought was a little strange.  Again, very modest portion size on that.  I got the pasta Bolognese and my wife got the cheese ravioli. Pretty good...nothing to write home about.  The ravioli was a really small portion. I think it came in a salad bowl.  The location is awesome.  It's easy to run up a bit of a bill here.  They've been around a long time. People must like it.  I'm more neutral on it.  Considering the restaurant choices in Old Town, I'd probably try something else next time.

0o9LrryToEjwOW0V_i3UWg.text: I stopped in here on a Saturday afternoon. There was no wait. Easy to get seated.  The service was good. I was served a starter of bread with butter that I swear had bacon blended in.   The fried artichokes were simply delicious. And very hearty. I could have eaten this alone and been happy.   There is a small outdoor area. Which gives you a good view to be able to people watch or to have people watch you eat. And indoors the decor was filled with sports memorabilia. The bar area had TV's for your viewing pleasure.  All in all, not a bad little place.   *note the woman's restroom was pretty clean too*

photos.caption: Photo of Italian Grotto - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fact #38

wxvznCFxYdBFQzmWABmiBQ.text: Was with a group looking for a place to eat.  We eventually stopped outside this establishment, where we encountered an incredibly rude host at the front door who completely scared us off after meeting him.  Apparently we were loitering around the entrance too much for his liking, because he tossed some choice insults with very colorful language our way, which I won't bother repeating here.  Needless to say we quickly left for better prospects.  After reading some other reviews here, apparently this was the owner!  I just wanted to reiterate how incredibly impolite and ill-mannered the staff at the front door was, and I shudder to think of what service must be like inside.  I would avoid this place at all costs, and I honestly can't believe they are in business if this is how they treat prospective customers.

y-nwDrV3QenQ8SkW8P877A.text: 5 stars for the fried mozzarella.  I'll be back. Phdhdududoududydyf Duffy fiddling terrific fight space filling.

1cgRQgeFIDuPycRkkk38xg.text: This was probably the only awful place in town. We paid $62 for two chicken alfredos, garlic toast, and two sodas. The pasta was worse than olive gardens and the garlic toast was mediocre and way over garliced. Save yourself the money and go somewhere else!!

4KWQ5snw_OAb0Ee2IjIChg.text: Worst Italian place ever.  - waiters were rude and didn't want to even accommodate us adding a chair to our table  - salads were old and even had some leafs that were rotten - the bread was old and hard  - my wife's fettuccini Alfredo tasted like a combination of cardboard and nothing and was completely cold. After the treatment when we got into the restaurant though we did not send the food back out of fear they would spit into it  - then the waiter filled up our sparkling waters with plain water - oh well there goes that taste.  - the plates had chips ...  It was like almost never ending.   I had been eating here once like 12 years ago and I guess now I remember why we never came back.   This time I will remember.

photos.caption: Photo of Italian Grotto - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

x5irJdrB_iAgwMOCCXdXJQ.text: We really should have read the reviews before walking in to this place. I guess I was attracted to the cute baseball mitt chair at the entrance and all the baseball banners, not to mention it was hot outside and wanting to grab a drink.   We walked in and took a seat at the bar. The bartender was very nice so this 2 star review is no way in reflection of him. He's the only reason I gave it the extra star. But there was this grungy manager (probably the owner) that was yelling at all his employees. I mean really cussing them out in front of all the customers. It made us feel so awkward and we wanted to just leave our drink and walk out of there (which we eventually did).   Then when we were walking out there was an older couple, probably in their mid 60's early 70's that were walking in. The manager/owner said "where do you think you're going and basically discouraged the couple from coming in. Again super awkward and we just wanted to get the heck outta there. I looked at some of the reviews after and it seems like that's common practice for this guy. Terrible service!

photos.caption: Photo of Italian Grotto - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

6EXmsW5ogvNsqdvwBTZ1RQ.text: This was the worst place ever!  Psychotic owner who yells at people and the worst service staff I have ever experienced.  The food was barely ok, but the service was unbelievably horrible.  The waiter took our order, then 1 minute 30 later one person asked to make a change.  He complained that they were already cooking it, even though we had not received apps or salads yet.  He then said, I took care of it for you.  Our entrees came out 45 minutes later and the waiter never changed the order instead he said the kitchen was already cooking the salmon... when I reminded him of the order change, he said too late unless you want to buy the other entree also then walked off.  I flagged down the manager/proprietor who also complained but said he would take care of it.  To his credit he corrected the order, but complained the entire time. The waiter with the bad attitude and horrible customer service never came back to the table until we flagged him down for the check.  I am guessing they get away with it since it's located in a tourist area of old towne Scottsdale.  Too many good restaurants to waste your time and money and a place with terrible service.

ivb-JHxNxvYIf7-ARS03rQ.text: Food is pretty good. One of the managers was EXTREMELY rude to my very obviously pregnant sister about using the bathroom last time we were in. We had reservations to eat there that night, but before even hearing us out he got in our face with a very condescending tone asking if we could read the "bathroom is for customers only" sign on the front door. Another costumer actually chimed in telling him that it was not right turning her away like that. Anyway, when he finally shut up enough to hear that we actually were customers, he gave my husband a complementary shot of whiskey to make up for his mistake. Guess that's just how they do it in NY lol. I'm sure they get walk in traffic asking to to use the bathroom all the time and are obviously frustrated by this.

Q7SLKL5vjG1gKLO-nHLsTw.text: Well.... I am not sure where to begin but this place was very entertaining for all the wrong reasons. I will begin with the atmosphere, to say the least, it's dated but I think that's why it's so charming. It reminds me of one of those classic Italian restaurants you hit up in New York. The food was decent, I think the portions were a bit modest and the plating could have been done better. However, I want to point out the perfect Meatball I had with my spaghetti, it was delicious! Now the service is one of a kind, the place is always busy so the owners and servers are quick to get you in and out. Don't expect to be here a while before they decide to throw you out. We witnessed quite a scene between the owner and customer. It was quite comical! Some yelling, throwing of towels, F bombs, and some serious caddy behavior. The customer was being irrational and extremely rude as well. Not that they deserved that treatment but you get what you have coming I guess. The owner is a no BS kind of woman from New York I'd assume.   Overall, if you're looking for good meatballs and some sassy service then I'd recommend this place.   There is this place in Chicago where the service is absolutely awful and rude but that's how they advertise there business and I will say the place is always crowded. People like the show that they put on. Perhaps the grotto should run with it and possibly meet the expectations of all the other reviews.

1QghagHRyY2v481lqo0xHg.text: Place smells a little grungy, food was mediocre... also owner was drunk and smelled like cigarettes but he was a nice guy.

bPo6vUfKX2sIj7WMDM3j9A.text: The charm of the decor doesn't make up for the rudeness of the staff. They seek only to maximize your bill. $37 for lunch with 2 wines. Don't go there, just don't go.

2E_Fc3BmCAtBP8dbo-0GEg.text: I would leave 0 stars if I could. Host was extremely rude, we came with our toddler and asked politely for a patio seat, and without hesitation he bluntly told us he doesn't want kids on the patio!?!? Really? Given there were no customers inside and seats available on the patio. My husband and I had eaten here once before and it was nothing special, was willing to give it another chance but now I don't think we will ever return.

Yxwsclzamqjwn0HhbONudg.text: I went to this restaurant today during the Parado Del Sol event. After waiting in line for twenty minutes the matre'd asked how many in your party. I told him two to which he asked where the rest of my party was. I told him my wife was waiting outside. He told me that when she arrived I could get back in line. I responded by telling him that I didn't think it was right that I had to get back in line. He then stated "then I won't serve you at all you ass****.  Needless to say I will never be back to this restaurant.  Jerry K

yiSYBHCkEIY0N7pzEtNZ5A.text: Tourist trap. Just because they've been there for 40 years doesn't mean the quality is great. Ordered veal parmigiana and a Caesar salad. Both very plain and simple, little flavor. Seemed like it was thrown together quickly. Server was not the least bit friendly or helpful. Don't settle for this place- there has to be better Italian food in Old Town!

T8VDqAQoaHuNE1mlS_cH2Q.text: Meatball is a meatball, to dark which is always a bad sign silverware wasn't clean spotty and the waiter named MB was quick but not helpful upgraded salad to Cesar was 7.00 and shredded like rabbit food no real parmigiana and he never asked if he could start us with some nice Italian bread instead he ask if we'd like some garlic bread which we agreed but wAs 12.00 most good Italian restaurants give you olive oil or garlic complimentary to serving you he just wanted a higher bill for a better tip! They need to clean up there act and get better more helpful service turning tables is one thing but up charging is disturbing when it as plain as day, overall the food wasn't terrible.

f9cxcW-4YQZNUEyS5Fo7jQ.text: Good and friendly service but mediocre food at best. The chicken fettuccine I ordered hardly had any chicken, to the extent that I seriously thought they forgot to add any. Prices are a tad high for what you get. Nothing to rave about and the saving grace is the decent service. The lighting is extremely insufficient unless the ambience they were going for is "candlelight."

mEf-67S-1moIVCVWsianmA.text: Surprised by the mixed reviews of the Gratto in Scottsdale. We were walking through Old Towne searching for something to eat for dinner and the smell of butter and garlic pulled us in as if we were in a trance.   The owner was very friendly when he greeted us at the door. The restaurant and bar were busy but seating was immediately available. And despite the fact the place was packed full of Giant fans the vibe was upbeat, pleasant and a place I could see revisiting on future trips to Scottsdale.   We started with some garlic bread and Minestrone. You better be a fan of garlic to enjoy the garlic bread. It was a bit overwhelming, but being a fan of the flavorful bulb this did not deter me from eating almost half a loaf. The soup was smooth. A nice tomato base with noodles, veggies and beans. It was not in itself something to write home about but provided a nice start to our meal.   For the main course we had Scallop Scampi and Cippiano. Both dishes surpassed expectations. The seafood was fresh and tender. Pasta was a perfect al dente and again there was not a lack of butter and garlic complementing the shellfish and pasta.   Dinner with drinks was a bit pricy but it's vacation. We enjoyed the meal and will certainly return on our next trip to the Valley of the Sun.

photos.caption: Photo of Italian Grotto - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cioppino at the Gratto.
Photo of Italian Grotto - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Scallop Scampi in a white wine butter sauce. Delish.

8WstiWyhbsHrR__eGH_h1Q.text: This is a wonderful Italian restaurant! The food was excellent. We had calamari , shrimp scampi and a Caesar salad . Service was excellent! We highly recommend this. We sat outside, we were not rushed.

rapyEIzGn6YJVJScvjtu1w.text: This is one of our favorite places to go when we are in Scottsdale. It's located in old Scottsdale where you could spend the day windowshopping and then having lunch or dinner here.  The menu is extensive, very authentic and have never had a bad meal.

kaqxLWqEOz_lxrDmUZYuig.text: Wow, what a great dining experience. I was in from out of town. The people I went with have been going there for many years. We were greeted by the owner who was nice and funny, he sat us.  I got the Eggplant Parm and it was delicious. The garlic bread came with sauce and was delicious. The soup was good but could have been hotter. The atmosphere is awesome, small but not too small and very "un-franchise like". Service was very good. Overall a very pleasant dining experience.

0CTmw6XbO9MCq7gAgVmuEQ.text: We were a party of 10 and we waited outside for the table to be ready. An inebriated woman told us she'd been in Scottsdale for a week and this was the worse meal she'd had. Deciding to take a chance we went in. The service was immediately great. Bread and water on the table and drink orders taken. The biggest martini I'd seen arrived (it was great), our orders were taken and the food was fantastic. Everything we expected. I had perfectly cooked halibut. My husband had veal piccata, and everyone raved about their food.  Not sure what the drunk women had a problem with, but I'm thinking it may have been her.

g7DVcCYheDTCpf0UFFcORg.text: The sleazy old man who owns or runs this place took one look at me wearing my Los Angeles Dodgers jersey and literally physically blocked me from entering the restaurant. You can tell this guy cares more about his pride than customers. He was rude, disrespectful, and lost a customer. I headed to Brat Haus and order from that trusty place instead  Don't waste your time with this place, there are better Italian choices in Old Town

XcirH3G_h3cHQEFPah99Fg.text: This is the place I take family and friends.   My ole reliable.   The graciousness demonstrated by the staff is amazing.  The indoors is beautifull I feel like I'm in Boston's North End with all the authenticity of the food.  Indoor European Italian ambience makes this place 5 stars.  I prefer indoors although the patio is seriously nice.   The food is a good price and truly amazing.   No sparkling water needed here this 100 percent GOOD !  I studied at Le Cordon Bleu and the ratings for Italian Grotto on Yelp is not deserved and am surprised of the lack of respect for the old world!  Knock Knock puddin heads.  This place is Amazing!!!!!!

Ege_Gam0zuzgjLgcY6MvxQ.text: As a general manager at a restaurant, I have never experienced the level of rudeness of a hostess as my family I did upon entering this out dated and empty restaurant. The hostess basically dismissed us and told us we can sit wherever we wanted. We immediately walked out. Very disappointing for my mom and grandma who are visiting from El Paso. Is there a zero stars option?

5Ne20_QEIHlmfUwqpXxt3g.text: Don't go Dirty Place Bad Service I got food poising and reported it to the county health dept. Food was bad as well, soggy bread, jut bad bad

CVmH4PQF0ebeVmcVnxqNPQ.text: The service , soup and salad was good. However the rest of meal was horrible: the bread was stale, simple red sauce tasted like straight it out a can no italian spices. The breaded veal cutlets were bland. The meals were over priced for what they gave you. This place is definitely not on my favorite place to eat. reconsider going to Grimaldi's once block way.

Bdf_tx6I62_0AEkZfpMeJw.text: I was in the mood for some Italian food and wanted to try some restaurants in my new neighborhood. We arrived at 9:18pm. Me and my room mate just about walked in the front door and a heavyset guy I think who had facial hair around 5'10" immediately walks up to us and asks if we were looking for the bar we said no we would like to get some food. He immediately walks us out and says let me give you some recommendations. We were extremely confused as to what was going on. We asked if we could eat there, he said no. So I asked if they stopped seating for the night and he asks where we were from. We said we just moved to town. I then asked what time do they stop seating because I was assuming that they were closing for the night. He replies "whenever we want" me and my friend are still pretty confused about the rudeness and the awkwardness in the situation and I say ok I get that but when do you stop seating on future nights so we could come back and try the restaurant and his reply was "don't come back!". As I sit here in the next restaurant we decided to go with I'm still extremely confused as to what just happened and it seemed like this guy was the manager or owner. Now that I see this places reviews and it is a 2.5 star with a lot of reviews from people who actually got to sit down and eat I'm pretty happy I didn't waste my money there. Well sir, we won't be coming back and I will be letting as many people as possible know about how you treat your customers!!! DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Italian Grotto - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This is the guy

FWLWAOAl9E7vZVdtwq1sDw.text: All of the servers were very nice made sure our experience was great. They made recommendations and answered questions. There was barely a wait for the food.

gBgS0BtWo12yYTMpvIUtwQ.text: WOW. Where do I start. We made the unfortunate blunder of eating at this restaurant this evening after a spring training game. We were greeted by a very friendly guy outside on the corner who worked there and told us there was no wait. So we thought we would give it a shot.  Nice atmosphere in this place. People drinking having a fun time seemed like pretty friendly staff. Then our waiter arrived to our table. MAN!!! What a creeper. He seemed to be high on some kind of narcotic , blood shot eyes. Didnt really introduce himself either. Explained nothing about the menu or any specials if any. By his overall demeanor and attitude seemed as though he was doing us a favor by taking our order. He also was wearing a baseball   cap too. He was very laps in filling waters and being over all attentive.  For the food. GEEEZ. We ordered the Fried calamari and by the looks of the portion I would believe our stoned waiter may have dropped half of it on the floor on the way to our table.It was some of the smallest scrap pieces of calamari I have ever seen!! Very bland too!! It was maybe 13 pieces very small too. the spicy marinara that came with it for dipping was pretty good so I thought "maybe this is not a total lose here". I was WRONG!!!  The salads came out with watered down dressing (blue cheese) and the salad had no flavor or texture. Throw in a crouton or red onion for some bite!!! Uneven chopped tomatoes too. It really looked like it was thrown together given the fact it came out 2 minutes after our calamari came to the table. (the portion of calamari was so small that we still pretty much finished it anyway) but still it seemed very rushed. And another waiter sarcastically said "seriously?" when we turned down parm cheese on the salad. As the only salad I put parm cheese on is a Caesar salad. Not a house salad with blue cheese.   Entrees , what a let down. I ordered the Veal Parmesan. It had no flavor the texture of the veal was very chewy not tender. The sauce was ok but not as good as what came with the calamari. They served it on a bed of rigatoni and there we maybe 8 pieces of pasta too. The breading on cutlets were not seasoned and the was not browned enough. The cheese was barely melted as well.   My girlfriend ordered the "white soupsagna" yes I said "SOUPSAGNA" as this white lasagna was a 3 layer mess swimming in a sea of alfredo sauce. The flavors were better then my veal . But again the portion for the price was sub par. It mostly was floating in this alfredo sauce. I can tell it was not baked. The noodles were strained in the colander , layered with the ricotta and DROWNED in the sauce. It did not have that signature resistance standing up to your fork when you dig in that you normally feel. It kind of just fell apart . The layers were very loose and soupy. Our bread was pre cut and must have been sitting too as the outside was getting stale.   I cannot believe this place has gotten the kinds of good reviews it has. Maybe it was what we ordered? Or an off night? But so many things missed that I cant believe this place has been serving scottsdale elite as long as it has.  I know Italian food. I am Sicilian, from New York and have studied Italian culinary cooking at schools in the city for years. I have eaten at Carmines and Raos in Manhattan. Dan Tanas in Los Angeles. These are good restaurants!! I know good italian food!! This is not it. You may be better off going across the street to Buca di Beppo  LOL . If you are in Scottsdale I would recommend Veneto Trattoria for italian.

CDY7zF_bHBf8QcLE1hBd6Q.text: This place was fantastic. Can not recommend highly enough. The halibut piccata was fabulous. Sausage and peppers were wonderful. A great sauce and the best Spumoni anywhere. Service was fantastic and fun. I will visit here anytime I'm in Scottsdale. Great value, retro vibe that is welcoming and friendly. Bring a date, bring the family. Great for groups.

h503sWddjNLoU0rWZcFVzQ.text: I was very pleased with this place.  Food was wonderful.  Service was great and the owner was funny and accommodating.  Going again soon.

olt_gYCGARlovFTUxf-mIA.text: Slinging  below  average  Italian food  to unsuspecting tourists  since 1977. The glass of water was pretty good...

OPqDBc4jrnhAwF8B15eMQA.text: God, if i could give this place negative stars i would. The owner is a friggin' prick and a half and the wait staff are just plain horrible - rude, entitled to not work or do anything, and acted like they were all around just annoyed that anyone would dare show up here. All the previous reviews about the so-called "owner" (or the guy who just looks like an old white disheveled vagabond at the front who likes to yell at and about people that come through the door) are absolutely spot-on. I should've read the reviews before coming to this place...please learn from my lesson and do the same if you're even thinking about coming here. Will never go back to this S&&Thole! As a side note, i walked down the street to Grimaldi's Pizza and that place is lightyears ahead in terms of food quality, service, and all around appreciation for your business.

4o5IgFi7p3v8yWTw-2eQrw.text: We stopped in Friday night for drinks at the bar after a performance at the civic center. The host was extremely funny and gracious. The bar tenders were also engaging. We saw the meals of a few people eating at the bar and decided to make a reservation for the next day.  Our dinner on Saturday was DELICIOUS, an authentic Italian meal. Our server was accommodating and he had back up support to help with his tables. The restaurant was well prepared to manage the larger crowds due to Spring Training and Spring Break.  The food portions were very satisfying. We shared the fried artichokes as an appetizer and shared the chicken parmesan roll. Even though we shared a meal they gave us two small house salads. We were both completely full after our meal and unfortunately did not have room for dessert.   I'll definitely eat here again on future trips to Scottsdale.

-ZaHtyq3VvVINew189goTw.text: I have no idea why this slum hole has a three star rating. I and many others would probably view it as a negative 3 star. All of the 5 star reviews are fake, there's no other explanation. Appetizers were over priced for the portions served. Pasta was over cooked however, our server Jason was fantastic. I wouldn't recommend this place to even my worst enemy, it has by far the worst host. He was rude and disrespectful to my entire party. He told my aunt, "get of my face" "I'm not talking to you" "leave" " we're done, bye". For a host such as himself & the over priced meals I don't recommend going here! Seriously save your time & money. Your better off eating at in & out.

n9r1xdWLLl8j1YZ7H8rbJw.text: Went yesterday and sat in the bar. Food was fine and waitress prompt and helpful. Owner was at the bar with a bunch of guys loudly extolling the brilliance of D Trump and making misogynistic comments about H Clinton. Regardless of your politics, who needs this at lunch. Won't be back.

CMoyOaW9KIsWEV2jMYRCJw.text: Food was excellent !!!  Just as I remembered!  The server was not good at all!  After not going there for about a year. I was in the area with family from out of town and had raved about the restaurant! Instantly they were turned off by the server bob's attitude!  We pressed through dinner and thank goodness for Paul the bus guy!

_8BRSxWDOrD4qsqYevC_eQ.text: I'd give this negative stars if I could. Way overpriced  for terrible food and a rude waiter. I was expecting so much more when we walked in and feel like we got entirely ripped off. I rarely give Yelp reviews but was so dissatisfied with our experience that I felt this was definitely worthy of one.

SwLwvrZSTth1B7UI_f_KjA.text: We were having lunch today and over heard the owner being extremely rude to a couple girls that need to use the bathroom. Instead of politely saying sorry the bathroom is for patrons only, he was vulgar and used the 'F' word and told them they can't use the bathroom and recommended they don't ever eat there!!! It was the oddest thing! The food was just OK. Not a place I will go back! You should value customer service!!!!

AB55sInLPmV8CfLF5minrw.text: One of the best Italian meals I have ever had! Service was great and our food was out quick. I got the fettuccine alfredo and it was so good. I'm very impressed with this restaurant:)

VxsRB0gd7jx9ZGkkY67N8Q.text: It is as a public service I post this review. The owner was over the top, absolutely rude. We were waiting for the rest of our party to be seated and he made a few rude comments insulting my husband and suggesting he and I go have a drink at the bar while my husband waited for our friends. We tried to joke it off at first. As our friends began arriving his tirade continued. Without saying a word we all walked out. He continued to follow us outside continuing his insults that were completely unprovoked and inappropriate. Please take a few minutes to read other reviews before even considering entering this establishment. Conversely, Pink Pony, just up the street ended up being both excellent food and service.

XKP54lwY3JR0q_sXg0okWg.text: We ate here prior to reading any reviews. I must say I was surprised by the negative reviews.  We arrived and were promptly seated for five. The wait staff even pulled out the table so we could ease into our table.  Our server was Harvey and he made every effort to keep us well watered and fed. We started with house bread which came with butter and I think seasoned cream cheese (or butter) with sun dried tomatoes. Altogether I'd say we had four servings of bread.  Next came clams in portofino sauce. That was promptly scarfed down by our youngest.  Then came mozzarella marinara. Each piece was individually served.  My wife had chicken Carolina, the daughter garlic and butter spaghetti, and the sons pasta bolognese and fettuccine Alfredo.  I had the eggplant Parmesan. It's weird that it has mushrooms but you can't even taste them. But you can feel the texture. And it was great.  We were hungry but left full. Only regret was we had no room for dessert.  I won't mind coming back next time we are in town.

gW6GW7Sbo6ahC6SGKL0LfA.text: On the disappointment scale, Italian Grotto ranks right up there with my never getting laid by my first girlfriend, whom I now know twenty years later is a lesbian.  Three entrees and I sampled all of them. The marinara dipping sauce was heavy with tomato paste and not at all a good marinara.  The clams swam in a broth so salty, it made my lips swell up like a pontoon boat. The fried calamari and artichoke were fried to a delicious, white coloration which, in the realm of fried foods, was about fourteen hues down from golden brown. This created confusion in my already befuddled mind. Was it cooked or wasn't it?  I Had to take a bite to solve the mystery. Unnerving.  I ordered an antipasto for two thinking I'd go light with meats, cheese, and relishes. Another huge disappointment. It looked like a salad with two buried slices of capicolla deep within and two, also buried, slices of salami. The remainder of the bowl was small bits of red and yellow peppers, about thirty pepperoncini, but mostly romaine tops. This was anything but a traditional antipasto, with the majority of the bowl comprised of lettuce. I don't know why IG hides the meat and cheese, but it pissed me off.  I felt like the catcher in a game of hide the salami. Literally!  I had to ask for bread since the antipasto was a bust. This made me feel like Oliver Twist begging for crumbs, and for no good reason at $12.95. The only thing good about this place was nothing.   I suspect they've remained in business all these years primarily due to their location, and all the unknowing tourists.  Never going back.

eJU72v0y0ZxV4_xYObJN8A.text: Bad service.  Ordinary food at prices too high for low quality.  Rude employees.  Old run down environment.  Don't waste your money.

PFmqsv7cqnk-VMB9A3YtWA.text: Easy access in great old town Scottsdale location. Parking can be tough if you go late. Got seated right away. Waiters and host very friendly like seeing an old friend each time you go there.  Restaurant is small and NY Italian style food. Service fast friendly and full size portions. Great authentic Italian dishes and appetizers. They pour long drinks and waiters try to be fun and will drink with you. Try the calamari, all pastas, meatball and sausage dishes. All winners. Great experience and mid to upper price range and worth it. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Italian Grotto - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spaghetti and meatballs! Yeah
Photo of Italian Grotto - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Grande lasagna
Photo of Italian Grotto - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

71WhQqV05bhzpeqngr9zXw.text: The owner of this restaurant is the rudest person I have ever encountered.  He reacted aggressively toward us at a simple request to keep some food warm. We were all perfectly civil, reasonable customers and were treated MOST disrespectfully.  The police were even involved when we wanted to leave in the middle of our meal. He succeeded in ruining our night and obtaining a large sum for food we did not eat because we were so offended by his behavior.  I do not often wish I'll will upon another person. But this man is despicable and I hope you will not support this business.   **the waiter Will was lovely, however

ZYV7G7bzxoPJ4REmYoX2Lg.text: What a dark place, It's romantic lighting I guess? There's a lotta ambient lighting from the open door, but it could be a bit lighter. We randomly showed up here because we wanted to go to the waffle house but it was packed (2 hour wait... yea not happening).  So italian is a good go to for me to try so we stopped here.  We parked in the back streets.  Nice place to walk around.  The waiter was really nice, I think he must be related to the owner or is the owner since he was not dressed the same as everyone else.  We had the bread and olive oil, it was not super strong olive oil but it was pretty good, and some really nice parm to go with it :)    We also go the garlic toast, wow it's strong stuff, i loved it but if you don't like super strong garlic with a sting, stay away.  The Shrimp Del Grotto was very good, a bit overly salty, the guy actually noted that it looked darker than normal, it wasn't to the point of not good so I kept it.    The Scallop Scampi was also very good, nice big scallops, even the picky lil girl liked them.  The calamari was pretty good as well.  The butter for the bread (which they serve normally, you have to ask for the olive oil) is a bit too solid, but it is some kinda red pepper butter and tasted good.  We did show up here on a Sunday around 2 pm, so it worked out that it wasn't too busy, the bar was hopping cuz there was some game going on and a lotta cheering which breaks that whole dark romantic mood lol.  Talk about conflicting message from teh same place but overall a place I'd go to again.  It is pricey though fyi.

U_PEKGF6gcvJ3uwkmjT3OQ.text: 3/1818 DO NOT EAT HERE! Greeted at door by owner with him saying " hey" thought was rude but we continued. After standing there for a moment ( they WERE NOT BUSY!) he said seat yourself ! We wanted outside. Chair cushions disgustingly stained. We were the only couple on patio. I went to use ladies room. IT WAS DISGUSTING! Horrible urine smell! Our water glasses... mine was DIRTY! Still had someones lipstick & finger prints!!! My husbands had big chip missing on bottom! We pointed it out to waiter he brought 2 fresh glasses this time my husbands had black stuff floating in it!! I ordered a house red. IT WAS Especially warm as if left out in sun! Husband had a beer. My bread plate I pushed aside it was filthy on edge & bottom! We decided to pay for drinks and leave. Out waiter overheard us and spouted out " that will be $14.00. I WASNT EVEN TALKING TO HIM! We approached owner to tell him our dissatisfaction and he started yelling at us ! He was so busy yelling when we tried to speak he dismissed us then said " lady what do you want me to do get on my knees" WE WERE SHOCKED AT HIS BEHAVIOR! So if you want a GREAT ITALIAN meal go a few blocks down the road to Miller and eat at Pasta Brioni!!!! Went there after leaving that dump in Old Town! Amazing service and AMAZING food and great prices!! The Grotto is a disgrace to Old Town Scottsdale!

LnE79LGb6Fm6IjHVIoPVWA.text: Such a cute Italian spot. Make SURE to sit in Koop's section. He is a fantastic waiter!

FQzbN0SkO1plYSnh_UL4tQ.text: Totally overrated.  Totally overpriced.  I ordered the chicken picatta.  Got half of a sliced up chicken breast.  Who got the other half?  For the price I paid of $21.00.   Waiter was arrogant.  And lastly, the minestrone soup was cold with gushy noodles.  So gross.  Just because they have prime property in OLD Town Scottsdale doesn't make them a great restaurant to eat at.  Will never go again.

aN-IkU3AKy3wLlLbSg0Ulw.text: The trailer park waitress said to me:  "So you're the asshole in the group!" apparently because I asked for no mussels in my seafood pasta.   When it arrived, it was so spicy I couldn't eat it.  They did not offer a replacement and charged me the full $32.  This place has a great location, but the management and wait-staff needs some charm-school training badly.

8yAo7F4R-Cct-zsH0yTYTw.text: The food AND service here is phenomenal! The food is fresh and tasty!!!! Meatball waited on us and he made excellent food and beverage  recommendations! If you're in Scottsdale and looking for a good Italian restaurant you MUST stop in at The Italian Grotto!

photos.caption: Photo of Italian Grotto - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. We just started our dinner feast!

51WbD7vSa2Zu-8jOiJLfAA.text: We visited on 2/10 , we called around 7 to check the wait. A very nice man said he would take our name and hold a table. When we arrived he greeted us at the door and held a beautiful table outdoors. The view and ambiance was great. Manager/owner was very pleasant and sweet. Food was good, service excellent. We were visiting  family here as we are from RHODE ISLAND.  We will absolutely be back again.

VqA7lcl59e3NR9soR7BGjQ.text: I went there last week it wasn't even busy I waited 15 plus min and no one came to take my order! I had to walk out of this joint   It should be ashamed to be have a location on old town and piss people off and run their business like an amateur little kids! I hope you guys shut down very soon!

bpG7M15BIm8l6dKlA5dgVw.text: The Chicken Carolina you cannot go wrong.  They need to change out their table balsamic as it seemed a little stale.  The table bread was decent, the butter was really good.  The house salad was also very good and a little different from traditional Italian house salads.  The service was very good.  Go to places like this while you can as they are few and far between.  You cannot have a bad dinner at a place like this with this atmosphere.  A hidden jewel in Old Town.

yicZy0gUl_QHwF1I8VxsLg.text: Great food, great service,  however some idiot that works there was offended after he said order up and so I repeated, order up.  He threatened to kick me out for saying order up.  What an idiot,  they have such great food, great bartender and the place is empty and I get threatened for saying order up, get a life loser! !!!

7hqtfu741XcZ1Gaub5fzpw.text: Not only was this place filthy, I was very disappointed with the service at this restaurant. After we paid our check, I got up to use the restroom. While my party was finishing their drinks and waiting for me to return, the owner asked them to leave because there were others waiting. This was our only negative experience in Scottsdale. The city has so many restaurants, I recommend skipping this one.

gvRTI3Q5Qq697nM_XTr6aw.text: Bar rescue needs to come here. Staff is unprofessional. Food is decent, but expensive.

DR_P3crszMrIIj1gRVeZaA.text: One star is generous. $10 per Cannoli and the filling tasted like vanilla pudding, not cheese. My wife ordered scallops and they were not prepared correctly (breaded, rather than fried with garlic and lemon). We ordered "tomato toast," which we thought was their version of bruschetta. We were served about 10 pieces of horrific garlic bread with a slice of Roma tomato on each with a side of jar spaghetti sauce. The experience was awful and before tip it was $77--no alcohol and my wife drank water. McDonald's would have been better.

DHN_BGYTh-NZI_3KOZ_fJA.text: We walked in with twelve guests including five young kids. Server Brandon was very patient with us. The food is nice - our kids often refused food but with this restaurant, they ate all the angel hair pasta we ordered. The soup was also very nice.

YPIlS6sdJKO6OxjSClKELg.text: I can't believe I had to even give this dump one star but I couldn't continue with my review unless I did.  I wish there were an option for negative stars.  This place is a dump, the food is inedible and the waiter Roberto as well as the owner are rude and totally unprofessional.

Av5JIi7_sWOc4N24JoeKiw.text: Came here on a busy Friday night with girlfriends during a girls' weekend.  Overall, the service was pretty decent. Our waiter was a little odd behaving, but certainly friendly.   I like the atmosphere of Italian Grotto. It's not too spendy, I love that the walls open up onto the sidewalk allowing for fun people watching. The last time I was there with my husband we sat at the bar and enjoyed watching some sports on tv while we drank and noshed.  This is a welcoming place to go when you want something fun and not too too god damned fancy,  I knocked off two stars for a couple reasons. I made reservations a couple weeks in advance and nevertheless we were given a crap table by the kitchen. We could have waited for another table, but we were hungry and wanted to get on with our evening. If you have a reservation on the books, try giving a non-reservation party the table by the kitchen and save that upfront table for the people who called ahead. Also, our waiter seemed a little out of it...despite the fact he was friendly he just didnt always seem lucid. He had a hard time keeping our order straight both forgetting one entire entree and refusing to split our entrees between three people (although he happily split them between two?).  The price for a bottle of Veuve was extremely fair. $90.

HCPyRE2HcqsJXvSAoASb9A.text: Visiting from out of state and saw an Italian place  to eat.  I normally don't  do reviews...but this place so yuck.  Had the scallops and they were chewy and fishy smelling.  Repeated my lunch the rest of the day and also the bathroom.  Would not recommend this place.  Way over priced for pasta.

X148GGL0-M4wTLV6VoDS-g.text: I wish I had read the reviews. The owner seated us. He is as rude and arrogant as others have mentioned. I ordered the steak salad. He was out of steak. He says it's because the steak is so popular. I think it's because they didn't stock it. The soup and garlic toast were tasteless. The soup was lukewarm as if it had been sitting out. After a while I felt like this had to be some sort of joke. The dated restaurant, the dirty bathroom, the attitudes, and the bad food. But when the check came, the joke was on me. You are better off anywhere else.

LF85gKT5Csn6oudemF0XSw.text: For a Benji [i.e. $100] this place was a huge disappointment for my wife and self. The service was decent but unfortunately the food was served cold and undercooked. I'm pretty bummed this place was such a huge let down. I will say this however, the owner is really good about honoring those who make reservations and not letting passer-bys whom didn't plan ahead get seated ahead.

3FLtHFUccrgLtOyp6H0N4g.text: Boyfriend and I spent a good deal of time here after the Spring Training game we went to. Just needed a place to relax, continue with the drinks, and hang out. As a disclaimer, this is a review for the atmosphere and the experience. We did not order any food here, just beers.  Pros: (+) Nice atmosphere. Got tables, a bar, and TVs so you can watch whatever game you want  (+) Down to earth - a lot of the staff seemed to know their patrons and have a personal relationship with them. Also willing to chat with you. (we were playing a game on our ipad and occasionally asked the bartenders for help solving a problem, and they were totally down to play and help out) (+) Full bar, sufficient assortment of beers (+) The food looked pretty good, from what I witnessed around the restaurant. Saw someone eating what looked like spaghetti and meatballs which looked delicious  Cons:  (-) One bathroom, which kinda sucks in a bar  (-) A few of the bartenders I noticed did have somewhat of an attitude, but I think you just kinda have to have a backbone and not let it bother you.   Overall, a cool dig.

5dODXpOYGv4nFTm0nTIYcw.text: Great caprese salad. Our seafood medley was excellent.  The marinara sauce and cream sauce was extremely tasty.  The chicken parmesan and chicken beneto Were also very tasty.  The malbec by the glass was also very good.  Great location in old Scotsdale. We finished dinner and walked to Scotsdale Stadium to watch  a great Fall league game betwen the Scorpions and the Javelina's!

9Iqp7GgtRrCOHWB_pzewzw.text: We too were going to eat at Bandera or we should have just eaten at the restaurant at the resort but unfortunately went to Italian Grotto. It is exactly as these reviews state - dark, old and has a bad odor but the food was fine. As we ate our salad a cockroach was crawling on the bench within inches. We discreetly flagged the waiter, told him and asked to move. The waiter later brought over a couple drinks. After a few minutes we heard escalating voices about six feet from us and within two feet of people sitting at the bar and a nearby table. Instead of taking the waiter into privacy, the man who I assume is the owner with the heavy N.Y. accent was yelling for at least fifteen minutes at the waiter about being free with HIS alcohol. His language included a few choice words also. This was the most awkward dining experience ever. The five star reviews have to be employees, the owner or paid reviewers.

xVGYEf19lGthrJJ1Z4dfnA.text: Worst service I have ever had at a restaurant.  Food was OK.  They don't even care about their yelp reviews, they told me they would help me write it.

8crwztDxMT8Nbcqu6skIzw.text: After a long day at the pool while on vacation, my DH and y Myself along with my 2 year old were famished and really tired.  We tried to go into a few other restaurants in the area but were turned down as my DH had on a tank.  My poor 2 year old was so tired and hungry by the time we arrived at this lovely restaurant. We were welcomed in and they immediately noticed how upset my daughter was. Brought out a cookie , water and offered to bring her food immediately.  The wonderful hospitality didn't stop there.  The manager heard my daughter say the word "ice cream, "and offered to take her in the kitchen so she could get her own.  Later she fufilled her promise, and  my daughter was so excited! Our food was absolutely delicious as well.  Would highly recommend this place.  The menu had many wonderful selections.  Fun place as well.

hWvs1cv07O8PFqdL9-4R5w.text: The worse service we ever had. Whoever reads the reviews on this restaurant do not go there. Long story short we were celebrating a birthday. There was 6 of us.
